Text:
EASY APPLE CIDER AT HOME
This Easy apple cider at home recipe sings fall and all things thanksgiving. No added sugar, and spiced to your hearts desire. At the end you're home smells so warm and welcoming.
You'll absolutely love the simplicity of this cider. I've been making this for quite sometime now regardless of the season in all honesty. The fall however is just the perfect time for a warm mug by the window, dreaming of the holidays.
You can make this in a pressure cooker or stove top. The pressure cooker significantly shortens the cook time obviously but the end results is absolutely the same.
A mixture of sweet and tart does the magic but you're welcome to choose sides here. Fuji , Gala or golden delicious for sweet and a granny smith for tart. The sweetness in the cider also comes from oranges. Valencia, cara cara or naval oranges are great options. I prefer to remove the skin to avoid any chance of a bitter after taste. Especially if you're cooking everything in the pressure cooker.
Everything goes into the pressure cooker or pot with just water and some cinnamon sticks. Add a little bit of you into the pot. Star anise, cloves , a touch of more citrus like lemon. Cook under high pressure for 15 minutes, This softens apples to a mush. Use a fine mesh sieve to strain (mashing with a wooden spoon or spatula). To get a more clear cider, strain again or pour cider through a cheese cloth.
SERVING
Keep on warm in your pressure cooker while your guest trickle in for that special Friendsgiving. Enjoy a warm mug as is or craft some cocktails with a splash of bourbon, rum or preferred dark spirit. Cheers to fall because this easy apple cider at home will surely be enjoyed
EASY APPLE CIDER AT HOME
This Easy apple cider recipe sings fall and all things thanksgiving. No added sugar, and spiced to your hearts desire and at the end you're home smells so warm and welcoming.
Prep Time: 5 minutes mins, Cook Time: 15 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 5 fuji apples
- 2 granny smith apples
- 3 Valenica oranges
- 5 cups of water
- 2-3 cinnamon sticks
Instructions
1. Wash and cut apples into chunks, removing seeds. Peel oranges and cut in large chunks. Transfer into pressure cooker
2. Add 5 cups of water and cinnamon sticks. Seal and set on high pressure for 15 minutes
3. Once ready, release pressure. Apples should be very soft. Carefully pour to a large bowl through a fine mesh strainer. With a spatula, mash pulp to get most of that sweetness.
4. Pour through an even finer sieve or cheese cloth to get a clear cider.
5. Pour and enjoy

Text:
EASY CANDIED ALMONDS
Make a bag of these easy candied almonds for your favorite people this holiday season and watch them oooohh and ahhhhh over it! There is something about adding homemade goods to your gift guide. That personal touch beats any store-bought goods especially if it is this delicious.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/10/Easy-Candied-Pecans-1.jpg?resize=1274%2C1784&ssl=1]
WHAT NUTS TO USE
These treats can be made with most nuts. So think, cashews, peanuts, walnuts , pecans, you name it.
We roasted some peanuts and made these favorite from Cameroon.
You can roast your nuts or use store bought nuts . This is also a way to revive all those back of the pantry nuts you abandoned a long time ago.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/candied-treat.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
Whether you are gifting a jar or bag these easy candied almonds this holiday season or any other time of the year, this one sure will be pleasing. Enjoy and don't forget to share what else you've been enjoying from the Afrovitalityeats kitchen.
EASY CANDIED ALMONDS
Gifting homemade good have never been easier with these easy to make candied almonds. Crunchy with just the right amount of sweetness.
Prep Time: 3 minutes mins, Cook Time: 7 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 2 cups roasted almonds
- 1 cup water
- 3/4 cup sugar
- 2 star anise
- 1 cinnamon stick
- 1/2 tsp vanilla
Instructions
1. Combine water and sugar into a large skillet and the cinnamon stick and star anise. Bring to a boil. 1 cup water, 3/4 cup sugar, 2 star anise, 1 cinnamon stick
2. Once sugar is completely dissolved, add in vanilla, and roasted almonds. Stir and let simmer 1/2 tsp vanilla, 2 cups roasted almonds
3. Continue to simmer on medium until sugar starts to crystalize.
4. Cook for a few more seconds, ensuring sugar does not caramelize.
5. Transfer unto a parchment paper and let cool for 3-5 minutes
6. Enjoy. Store leftovers in an airtight container

Text:
EASY BROCCOLI SALAD
This easy broccoli salad is a crowd pleasing favorite that you can put together with minimal effort. A little chopping and grating here and there and you have this wonderful bowl of goodness that is guaranteed to satisfy. Visit your local grocers and gather these fresh ingredients. You'll definitely be making this another time.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/broccoli-salad-1.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
INGREDIENTS FOR BROCCOLI SALAD
- Brocolli: Fresh tender broccoli florets bring in a crisp bite to the salad. Rich in vitamins, fiber, minerals and phytochemicals known for their potential cancer fighting properties.
- Apples: The refreshing crunch of crisp fuji apples adds a sweetness that balances the slight bitterness from the broccoli.
- Craisins (Dried Cranberries): They are sweet and tangy and brings in a nice chewiness to the salad.
- Red Onions: They add a bold zesty kick to the salad, bringing together the tanginess and sweetness of the apples and cranberries.
My kids, who have an avid aversion for uncooked broccoli absolutely enjoy this salad. Perchance it is the sweet crunchy bite of the golden delicious apples, or maybe the chewy tangy bite of the craisins. We will not try to answer the why but will stick to fulfilling the "more please " request.
For me, the dressing makes it! We enjoy this dressing on many salads but we are going heavy with no apologies on this broccoli salad. Toss a generous amount over your chopped and shredded veggies. Feel free to save some for later if the salad seems overly dressed. If you do save some, try with this salad bowl recipe. You will definitely keep this one handy.
You can make this ahead and chill until serving time. You will have to dress the salad to prevent the apples from browning and once your guests arrive, just give it a good toss and serve.
Hope you enjoy this one as much as we did, and don't forget to share all what you've been enjoying from the Afrovitalityeats kitchen.
EASY BROCCOLI SALAD
Bring in the crunch, sweetness and colorful essence of broccoli, apples and carrots paired with a creamy homemade dressing to any gathering
Prep Time: 20 minutes mins, Cook Time: 5 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 3 Cups of broccoli, chopped
- 1 cup grated carrots
- 2 cups golden delicious apples cubed
- 1/4 cup craisins
- 1/2 cup red onions
DRESSING
- 1/3 Cup mayonnaise
- 1/3 Cup plain Greek yogurt
- 2 Tbsp hibiscus infused vinegar ((or any vinegar))
- 2 Tbsp cane sugar ((or honey))
- 1.5 Tbsp yellow mustard
- 2 Tbsp honey ginger balsamic vinegar
Instructions
1. Combine all salad ingredients into a large bowl. Whisk dressing ingredients until creamy. Pour over salad and toss well. Serve or chill for 20 minutes before serving 3 Cups of broccoli, chopped, 1 cup grated carrots, 2 cups golden delicious apples cubed, 1/4 cup craisins, 1/2 cup red onions, 1/3 Cup mayonnaise, 1/3 Cup plain Greek yogurt, 2 Tbsp hibiscus infused vinegar, 2 Tbsp cane sugar, 1.5 Tbsp yellow mustard

Text:
Easy Crockpot Mixed bean stew
There are days when you have a million and one things to do and just need a "throw it all in the crockpot" solution for dinner. This easy mixed been soup definitely came to the rescue with some wonderful flavors to go with. Key is to always have some cooked beans around ( or assorted canned beans). Most of the ingredients should be in your pantry so it's definitely an easy , yet delicious meal idea.
Had some precooked black and white beans in the freezer. Key word FREEZER. Do not store cooked beans long term in the fridge. In a few days you'll find yourself opening all windows and doors regardless of the temperature outside.
Like I said before, everything was thrown in a crockpot and by the end of my day, a steaming bowl was served for dinner.
Bean Stew
[image: https://i0.wp.com/www.afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Crockpot-Spicy-Mixed-Bean-Soup-1024x1024.jpg?resize=1024%2C1024]
EASY CROCKPOT MIXED BEAN STEW
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 4 hours hrs
Ingredients
- 1 1/2 cup white beans ((precooked and lightly salted))
- 1 1/2 cup black beans ((precooked and lightly salted))
- 14 oz can fire roasted tomatoes
- 10 oz can tomato sauce
- 1 medium Onions chopped ((About 1 cup))
- 3 cloves garlic chopped
- 2 cups water ((Or vegetable broth))
- 1/2 tsp cumin
- 1/2 tsp smoked hungarian paprika
- 1/2 tsp cayenne
- 1/2 tsp sugar
- 1/4 tsp nutmeg
- salt to taste
- chopped pasrley ((optional for garnish))
- 2 bay leaves
Instructions
1. Combine everything in a crockpot, turn the heat on high and cook for four hours . (Or cook on low for 6-8 hours). Switch to warm and let sit for another 30 minutes. Garnish and serve with bread.

Text:
Easy Chia Pancake with Strawberries
Easy Chia Pancake! A great morning for most starts with a cup of coffee or tea depending on where you are around the globe. Pancakes, Bread and tea, puff puff and beans, akara and beans, fried plantains and eggs, bread and pap......these were some of my favorite breakfast items growing up. ( Still are!). Pancakes or crepes like some will call was definitely top of the list. My mother's recipe was super simple, sugar, flour, eggs and milk. Sweet , warm , soft breakfast delight. Today I'm giving this childhood best-loved breakfast a little boost.
Oh! No time for breakfast? Just figured out (MAYBE NOT!) if I go to bed two hours earlier than I usually do, I can treat myself to these moist, warm, melt in your mouth easy chia pancake! Super easy and it really did brighten my morning and subsequently my day. Added some chia seeds for a little boost and crunch, topped off with some fresh strawberries and some amazing Wisconsin maple syrup.
Gotta indulge once in a while.
EASY CHIA PANCAKES W/ STRAWBERRIES
Easy pancakes with chia seeds, topped with fresh strawberries and maple syrup
Prep Time: 5 minutes mins, Cook Time: 15 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 1 medium egg
- 2/3 cup unbleached all purpose flour
- 1 1/2 Tbsp sugar
- 1 tsp chia seed
- 1/4 tsp ground nutmeg
- a pinch of salt
- 1 cup fresh strawberries sliced
- 2 Tbsp Maple syrup
Instructions
1. Whip egg, sugar and salt until creamy.
2. Then add in milk and mix well. Whisk nutmeg, chia seeds and flour separately, then slowly add into egg mixture 1/4 cup at a time while gently mixing. (Optional- Set for 15-20 minutes)
3. Using a non stick medium small fry pan (10 inch) greased with Pam Spray, fry pancakes until golden brown on each side. Use about 1/4 cup batter at a time.
4. Fold , then top with fresh strawberries and a drizzle of warm maple syrup

Text:
Easy Frothy Matcha Latte at Home
This easy frothy matcha latte is amazing and comes together in under 5 minutes and with no fancy kitchen gadget. It can effortlessly be incorporated into your morning routine.
MATCHA
Matcha is a green tea powder made from griding young green tea leaves. It has significant antioxidant properties and also loaded with vitamins and amino acids. There is something about a cup of Matcha, be it warm or on ice. And that frothy goodness that makes you feel like you're visiting your favorite tea shop but in sweatpants. No latte art here but the fact that you still see some frothiness down to your last sip definitely speaks volume about this little trick.
MILK OPTIONS
Here we are using almond milk. Other non-dairy milks to use include oat, cashew, soy or whatever you like. Dairy gets frothier so you have the option of using some cow's milk too.
When shaking, you want to open the shaker in 10-15 second intervals to release the pressure build up. Do these a few times, pour and enjoy. Also, it is best if the milk is not piping hot.
SWEETNERS TO USE
Use your choice of sweetener but if you're using honey for an iced matcha make sure you add it into the shaker before pouring over ice. If not, the honey forms a not so pleasant clump. You can also sweeten with maple syrup or cane sugar. Feel free to skip sweetening all together.
FROTHY MATCHA LATTE AT HOME
This is probably going to be the simplest matcha latte you'll ever make. It works whether you are enjoying it warm or iced. The trick to the frothiness is simply a protein shaker with a wire ball. Milk should be warm and not boiling hot! You can microwave for 45 seconds to a minute.
EASY FROTHY MATCHA LATTE AT HOME
This matcha latte is extra frothy and comes together with just a protein shaker and three ingredients.
Ingredients
- 1/2 tsp matcha powder
- 8 ounces almond milk (or milk of choice)
- honey to taste ((or maple syrup))
Instructions
1. Measure out milk and transfer to a microwave save container. Microwave for 30-45 seconds
2. Transfer into a protein shaker. Then add matcha powder and honey.
3. Close and shake for 5-10 second intervals, releasing built up pressure between shakes.
4. Repeat 3-4 times or until frothy to your likeness.
5. Pour and enjoy

Text:
EASY HIBISCUS SUN TEA
WHAT ARE SUN TEAS?
It's simply tea brewed in direct sunlight. All you do is steep your tea bags or favorite loose leaf teas in room temperature water and let the sun have at it. You can sun brew for up to 3-4 hours but its recommended to keep it under 4 hours. With sun tea brewed at a lower temperature comparably, there is some worries about bacteria growth. That being said, the risk is low to negligible if you follow simple sanitation procedures to prevent contamination. It is best to refrigerate right away and we typically drink up the batch made within a day.
EASY HIBISCUS SUN TEA BREWING
We start of with some quality ingredients. Find the best dried Sorrel you can lay your hands on, some fresh ginger, lemon and mint. Thoroughly wash your ingredients and peel ginger. Wash and sanitize a desired sized glass mason jar with a tight seal. Add all ingredients into jar, pour water to cover and seal. Set this under the sun for about 2 hours. It's important to not add any sweeteners while brewing. Again we are brewing at a much lower temperature than regular teas.
SERVING SUN TEAS
We brew sun teas when the summer heat is sometimes unbearable so it is very obvious that we serve over ice. In my humble opinion they make the easiest and most refreshing infused iced teas ever. After brewing, depending on what other flavors you infused floating along side your tea, strain . Then sweeten to your hearts desire or just enjoy as is over ice.
When I polled how many people have heard about sun teas on my Instagram, I realized they are not really known to most. Hope you learned something new today and realize you don't always have to pull out the pot or kettle. If you're going to get scorched by the sun you might as well brew some sun tea.
EASY HIBISCUS SUN TEA
Prep Time: 1 minute min, Cook Time: 2 hours hrs
Ingredients
- 2 quarts room temperature water
- 1/4 cup loose leaf dried sorrel
- 1 large lemon washed and sliced into thin rings
- 2-4 sprigs of fresh mint
- Sugar to taste ((optional))
- Ice cubes
- 1 inch chunk of ginger peeled and sliced thin
Instructions
1. Place sorrel in a tea bag and tie.
2. Transfer all ingredients into mason jar except for the sugar and add water. Seal and place under direct sunlight to brew for 2 hours and no more than 4 hours.
3. Strain, sweeten to taste and serve over ice with fresh mint.
Notes
You can brew any tea under the sun! If you want a stronger tea brew longer. However still keep in mind the release of tannins, resulting in bitterness with longer brew time. Once again, keep everything sanitized and clean

Text:
Easy Mango Kiwi Salsa
Kick off the party with this colorful mango kiwi salsa. A fresh burst of flavor with each bite. Sweet, salt, a little tangy and some heat from jalapenos that brings everything together wonderfully.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/07/mango-kiwi-salsa.jpg?resize=1147%2C1720&ssl=1]
This playful take on salsa orchestrated by my five-year-old that has now become one of our favorites. A fun and definitely different way to use up fruits.
FRUITS IN SALSA
The traditional salsa or pico de gallo will contain mainly tomatoes, onion, jalapenos, lime juice, salt and black pepper. Sometimes adding some cilantro too.
This mango kiwi salsa deviates from mainstream salsa with more sweetness. Going a little heavy on the lime juice helps balance the sweetness from the mango and kiwi. Jalapenos may be optional but that little kick really brings everything together. To help tame the heat, slice down the middle and scoop out the seeds.
There are so many other fruits you can add to salsa. Pineapple being a favorite next to mango. Use fresh or grilled, and same goes with the mango. Peaches, especially when they are in season from may through august. Watermelon and berries too.
STORING
With how quick these ingredients can be put together, we prefer to make it the day off and chill in the fridge before serving. With the high sugar content from the fruits, eating it up within 3 days is best. Fruits will start to break if stored longer and this will impact the flavor.
WHAT TO SERVE WITH SALSA
We are keeping the chips and salsa here but there is an array of ways to enjoy this mango kiwi salsa.
Entertaining? Serve as cold salad bowls or cups.
Add a scoop on some romaine hearts for a fresh , crisp bite.
Serve over some grilled fish, say salmon or pan seared mackerel. All that acid pairs wonderfully with the fattiness of the fish.
Most importantly , serve with good company!
MANGO KIWI SALSA
Kick off the party with this colorful mango kiwi salsa. A fresh burst of flavor with each bite. Sweet, salt, a little tang and some heat from jalapenos that brings everything together wonderfully.
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 5 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 1 cup diced kiwi
- 1 cup diced ripe mango
- 1 and 1/2 cup Roma Tomatoes diced
- 1/3 cup chopped white onion
- 1/4 cup minced cilantro
- 3 Tbsp lime juice
- salt and black pepper to taste
Instructions
1. Combine all ingredients in a large bowl, add lime juice last. Mix well and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately or chill and serve later
2. Enjoy with chips or romaine hearts

Text:
Easy Stove Top Granola with Pepitas
This easy stove top granola has just the right amount of sweetness, crunch and perfect for that morning parfait, or as a topping to a sweet breakfast bowl
This granola recipe, a tart sweet from molasses is simply the best. You can whip up a batch in no time and have that delightful breakfast parfait you've always wanted. Things were kept really simple here, but we encourage you to make it your own.
You'll need some old fashion oats. Quick oats really won't work as good here. I prefer coconut oil because I like that hint of coconut. You can take this even further by adding some coconut flakes if you are really into coconuts. Vanilla and nutmeg are probably used in every sweet thing I bake or roast. The Mexican vanilla used was actually a gift from a coworker. Needless to say it came in handy here and with other sweet treats. You can easily overdo it with nutmeg so just a pinch is good enough. Cinnamon is a good substitute for nutmeg.
You might be tempted to crank up the heat and get things cooking fast but I'd rather you not ruin an amazing batch of granola. Maintain at medium heat and stir frequently to avoid burning. You might also want to multitask but stay as close as you can to the skillet. Nothing is more frustrating than ruining things at the last minute. Once ready simply cool on parchment paper. Store in a sealed container or zip lock bag and enjoy in parfaits , oatmeal bowls or as is. Be a darling and impress your friends with a jar or two as gifts.
Hope you try this easy stove top molasses granola recipe and enjoy it as much as we did.
EASY STOVE TOP GRANOLA WITH PEPITAS
Prep Time: 5 minutes mins, Cook Time: 25 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 3 Cups Rolled oats
- 1 Tbsp Coconut oil
- 2 Tbsp Molasses
- 1 Tsp Mexican vanilla
- 1/4 Tsp nutmeg
- 2/3 Cup Pepitas
Instructions
1. Combine oats, pepitas and nutmeg in a large bowl. Mix well 3 Cups Rolled oats, 2/3 Cup Pepitas, 1/4 Tsp nutmeg
2. In a cast iron pan over medium heat, melt coconut oil, stir in molasses and vanilla. Then add in oats mixture and stir well until completely coated. 3 Cups Rolled oats, 2 Tbsp Molasses, 1 Tsp Mexican vanilla, 1 Tbsp Coconut oil
3. Cook on low to medium heat, stirring frequently until granola turns golden brown. Remove from heat and transfer to parchment paper to cool. Use in parfaits, oatmeal bowls and more. Or store in airtight containers for future use.

Text:
Folere ( Cameroon Hibiscus Ice Tea)
Folere! Folere! Buy ya folere! That's the call you hear from folere sellers. That is the call you want to hear on a busy market day, with scorching temperatures of about 90 degrees or higher. They come to you, but it's never unusual to hear people ask where the folere seller was last spotted. This is the ultimate thirst quencher. Sweet with a little tang and typically served chilled .You find vendors mostly in busy markets, bus stops and little stands between towns . Just like the lemonade stand, there is a folere stand.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/hibiscus-tea..jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
Some sellers go to the markets early to catch the morning crowd, while others await the midday heat. Plastic bottles filled to the brim seating in ice buckets. Don't be alarmed if the seller asks you to return the bottle. You can pay a little extra to keep the bottle or bring your own bottle for exchange. Sometimes customers will gulp down a bottle right next to the stand.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/hibiscus-tea.jpg?resize=682%2C1024&ssl=1]
Folere is a very simple tea you can enjoy at home. Some have added unto the original recipe; lemon juice, cinnamon, orange juice and more. All you really need is a pineapple , water, sugar and most importantly dried roselle sepals ,a type of hibiscus . Folere is also known as zobo in Nigeria, bissap in Senegal and sorrell in the Caribbean. So really simple and very affordable to make.
It is tempting to rush the process but you will be missing out on the flavors and that unique folere taste. My recipe started at 8pm the night before and I enjoyed my first ice cold sip about noon the next day. The key to let everything soak for at least 6 hours. Considering we are using pineapple peels, do thoroughly wash before cutting. Though optional , I added a cup of pineapple chunks for good measure. I also find combining the water with the pineapple peel and bringing it to a boil before adding the hibiscus help the flavors develop even better.

Folere
- 1 medium pineapple
- 2 cups dried hibiscus sepals (roselle)
- 4 quarts water ((Use less water for a stronger tea))
- 2 cinnamon sticks ((optional))
- 7 cloves ((optional))
- 1/3 cups sliced ginger
Simple Syrup
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup water

1. Thoroughly wash and peel pineapple. Cut up pineapple flesh into quarter inch chunks. Combine pineapple peels, 1 cup of the pineapple chunks and water in a large pot. Bring to a rapid boil and cook for 10 minutes.

Text:
Friday Series: Freezing fruits and berries
Frozen Berries anyone? My favorite summer obsession is freezing berries and fruits. An absolute best for not only breakfast smoothies but other yummy morning treats!
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2016/07/image4.jpeg?resize=2962%2C2976]
We've all done it, or maybe I'm the only wrongdoer when it comes to freezing berries. Tossing a bag of berries, or sliced fruits in the freezer and dealing with huge chunks when your favorite smoothie recipe calls for a cup of berries. I've had to use a knife, hammer, metal tongs you name it, to break these chunks. That's not only cumbersome but also very unsafe.
Why the hassle when there is a very simple solution. Freeze right and enjoy later! Now I can buy lots and lots of berries on sale, make a frozen berry medley for future use.
Freezing Berries
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2016/07/frozen-berries.jpg?resize=3961%2C3000]
Its summer time!
Berries are in season.
There are farms around that will offer pick your own berries for as low as $1.50 per pound . Gather up the kids or a buddy and have a fun experience picking your own berries. You can now say "farm to table" when you make that delectable compote to go with your morning flapjacks!
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2016/07/image2.jpeg?resize=2999%2C3000]
Picked up almost 10 pounds of assorted berries and enjoyed prepping them for freezing. The result was a delightful medley of strawberries, blueberries and black berries. Raspberries will definitely be added onto the batch at home in the future.
First things first , get the most succulent berries you can find. If you pick your own, then you can guarantee their freshness. Ensure there are no soft squishy spots. Check the bottom of those clear pint containers if you're getting them from your local market.
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2016/06/blackberries.jpg?resize=2371%2C3000]
If you plan on having some fresh unfrozen berries, wash them only when you're ready to eat. They will last a little longer in the refrigerator unwashed.
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2016/07/strawberries.jpg?resize=3352%2C2969]
Transfer strawberries into a colander and rinse thoroughly under a stream of cool tap water. You can use a use any all natural vegetable cleanser if you want but I just use water. Using the tip of a pairing knife or any other easy to hold knife, carefully remove the stem by cutting a circle around the stem and gently tugging. You can freeze these whole but I slice them into four triangles. Spread in a single layer on a cookie sheet and freeze for about an hour and a half. At 30-45 minutes, use a firm rubber kitchen spatula to stir things around. Continue to freeze until frozen solid. Pull apart any berries stuck together. This should be easy since they were frozen in a single layer. Transfer into a zip lock bag and freeze for future use.
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2016/06/berry-medley.jpg?resize=3872%2C3000]
Some say you can freeze these without washing, I prefer to wash mine. Just like strawberries, if you plan on eating some fresh, wash just before eating. Rinse under running water in a colander, and let dry to remove excess water on a kitchen towel. Spread on a cookie sheet and freeze for about an hour and a half or until they sound like marbles. Transfer into a zip lock bag for future use.
Making the medley is as simple as combining all berries into one bag, giving it a nice shake and you're good to go. Now you can enjoy this easy to scoop medley anyday
Same concept with any fruits. Dice 'em up and freeze for smoothies or whatever fun creative ideas you have.

Text:
EASY TURMERIC RICE
This turmeric rice is one of our easiest and quickest rice dishes to make. Fragrant, colorful and with fresh herbs. This is our go to when the plain rice just won't cut it.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/06/Turmeric-rice.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
WHAT YOU'LL NEED
When we say simple we really mean simple. Gather these ingredients and have a side dish on the table in just about 20 minutes.
Basmati Rice : We love to use basmati rice for this but you can also use jasmine rice or what you have. Rinse your rice and let it dry. For a start, we like to toast our rice in oil with onions and garlic. The aroma is a tell tale of what's to come.
Turmeric Powde r: Turmeric has an array of health benefits, but we are using it here for culinary purposes mainly. For the bold, warm earthy notes that really elevates the overall flavor of the rice. Try not to add too much as turmeric could be bitter in excess.
Chicken Broth : This makes it for me. Vegans and vegetarians can use vegetable broth, but chicken broth really adds a whole 'nother depth of flavor.
Onions and Garlic : Our favorite go to aromatics and they very much complement the earthy notes of the turmeric.
Fresh Coriander : Once your rice is ready, fluffing it with a good hand pinch of chopped fresh cilantro brings in some color contrast and really ties everything together.
MAKING TURMERIC RICE
Our first step in toasting the rice and we do this as we saute the onions and garlic. Saute your onions for two to three minutes, then add you washed, dried rice and start toasting. It is important for your rice to be dry so we are actually toasting and not steaming the rice.
After about 3 minutes, add in turmeric and garlic and stir until garlic is just fragrant . This should take under a minute. Avoid burning the garlic.
The final step is adding your broth. There will be a vigorous steam so be careful and add broth slowly. Season with salt and black pepper, cover with foil and a tight lid to trap in the steam and you're done. After 20 minutes, remove from heat, let stand for another 5 minutes and fluff with some chopped fresh coriander.
TO SERVE
Serve with some sauteed greens and your favorite protein to make this a complete meal. Here's a Salmon or Chicken recipe that will pair wonderfully with this turmeric rice. When you get to make and enjoy this, let us know what you think on our social meddia platforms
EASY TURMERIC RICE
Fluffy, vibrant and fragrant turmeric basmati rice cooked with chicken broth.
Ingredients
- 2 cups basmati rice
- 3 Tbsp avocado oil
- 1 cup diced sweet onions
- 4 garlic cloves crushed
- 3 cups chicken broth
- 1 and 1/2 tsp ground turmeric powder
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
- 1 and 1/2 tsp kosher salt
- 1/4 cup chopped cilantro ((optional))
Instructions
1. Heat oil in sauce pot and sauté onions until translucent. Then stir in rice and toss for about 3 minutes.
2. Add garlic and continue to stir for another 30 seconds to a minute until fragrant.
3. Carefully add in chicken broth (Expect vigorous boiling and steam).
4. Then add in turmeric, black pepper and salt to taste. Stir, cover with foil to trap most of the steam before adding a tight lid.
5. Reduce heat to medium low and slowly simmer for 20 minutes or until all the broth has been absorbed. Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes.
6. Add in chopped cilantro, fluff and serve.

Text:
FRESH DAILY JUICES
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/fresh-juices.-1.png?resize=576%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/Fresh-juice.jpeg?resize=576%2C1024&ssl=1]
These fresh daily juices are just what you need when you intentionally or unintentionally buy too many fruits and veggies. Naturally sweet refreshing and just downright good for you. This time of the year is especially trying with the many bouts of cold and flu circulating around our communities. These ingredients were purposefully chosen for this reason and its been great having a jar of these juices in the fridge.
These ingredients are loaded with vitamins; have antioxidant, anti inflammatory properties and so much more.
STORING FRESH DAILY JUICES
We use fresh organic fruits and vegetables for our juices. These are thoroughly washed and skins peeled before blending. We make enough to consume within a day or two, hence our decision not to pasteurize. If you intend on storing for longer, we highly recommend pasteurizing. Here is a little info on juice safety at home. We want you to safely enjoy a glass of these at home .
Ready for more winter weather immune boosting drinks? This turmeric shot recipe is another favorite.
IMMUNITY
Prep Time: 5 minutes mins, Cook Time: 5 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 3 Apples - cubed ((About 3 cups))
- 2 small Oranges
- 3/4 cup Lemon
- 1 cup Celery- diced
- 1/4 cup Ginger- sliced
- 2 cups Carrot
- 1 and 1/2 cup cold water
Instructions
1. Add all ingredients into a high power blender. Add water and blend until smooth.Use a cheese cloth or fine mesh strainer to strain. Serve over ice or store for up to 48 hours.

Text:
FRIED RIPE PLANTAINS AND BAKED SWEET POTATOES
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/herb-baked-sweet-potato-wedges.jpg?resize=1060%2C1590&ssl=1]
Herb baked sweet potatoes and sweet fried ripe plantains.
DINNER INVITATION
Getting invited over for dinner gets me super excited....I call dips on apps! Yes , not just the bounty from the host but also what we get to take along. Our wonderful neighbors, bless their hearts invited us for and we couldn't wait to join them. We always have an amazing time with them.
See this bounty? That's from my neighbors garden last year. He basically fed the whole neighborhood.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Gardening.jpg?resize=1181%2C1771&ssl=1]
His decision to not have a garden this year broke my heart. Little did I know "No garden" means
"take a look at my asparagus garden". Am I the only one who didn't know what an asparagus plant looks like?
I have a few tomato plants, there are some watermelons , cucumbers, okra......"
I'm guessing no garden means, thriving garden! I am definitely not complaining. We get to enjoy another summer of great produce.
WHAT'S COOKING?
So, back to the appetizers. We wanted...
Something simple,
Something African,
and downright delicious.
Can we ever go wrong with plantains? Or sweet potatoes? I don't think so. I call these African sweet potatoes because they are just like what we have back home. They are also Caribbean or Japanese sweet potatoes. One of my most loved starter course paired here with a spicy pepper sauce.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/herb-baked-potatoes-and-plantains.jpg?resize=1119%2C1679&ssl=1]
A platter like this will definitely keep your guess returning for more.
This simple sauce brings everything together. "Planty and pepper" like we say. So simple , sometimes I make a batch and refrigerate for about a week or more. You can go as spicy as you want. Some sweet onions, peppers and fresh herbs. Its that easy. You'll find yourself enjoying the sauce with a lot more .
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/herb-baked-sweet-potatoes-and-friend-plantains.jpg?resize=1280%2C1755&ssl=1]
Plantains are so versatile. You can season them up however you want prior to frying! Here I used Essiespice Mekko Dry Rub . Other options include, ginger , garlic, paprika, onion powder ad so much more. Endless options. A plantain dish of some sort always makes it to the dinner table when I have friends coming over. You can never go wrong with sweet fried ripe plantains. Try this one, and don't forget to share what you're cooking from the afrovitalityeats kitchen.
HERB BAKED SWEET POTATOES AND PLANTAINS
Ingredients
- 4 medium sweet potatoes
- 2 Tbsp packed minced parsley
- 1 Tbsp minced garlic
- 1 Tbsp Basil Olive oil
- a pinch of salt
Plantains
- 3 large ripe plantains
- 1 Tbsp essie spice mekko dry rub
- 2 pinches of kosher salt
Pepper sauce
- 2 small scotch bonnet peppers ((or habanero-more for a hotter sauce))
- 4 garlic cloves
- 2 sprigs Of parsley
- 1 small green onion
- 4 roma tomatoes
- 1-2 Tbsp olive oil
- 1 small sweet onion
Instructions
potatoes
1. Preheat oven to 375
2. Wash, peel and cut potatoes into wedges. Set into a cool water bath to prevent browning. Once done, drain and pat dry with a kitchen towel.
3. Transfer into a bowl large enough to toss. Add in olive oil, parsley, garlic, salt and toss. Transfer to a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake at 375 for about 25 minutes until golden brown. Flip wedges about 15 minutes into baking. Serve immediately with sauce
Plantains
1. Wash peel and slice plantains as shown.Combine with mekko dry rub into a large bowl and toss well.
2. Heat oil to about 360-375 degrees. Fry plantains until golden brown. Transfer unto a paper towel to drain excess oil. You can toss with more of the dry rub after frying. Garnish with fresh parsley and Serve with pepper sauce.
Pepper Sauce
1. Blend all ingredients with about 3/4 cup of water and transfer to a sauce pot
2. Bring to a a gentle simmer and cook for about 20 minutes until contents reduce into a thick sauce. Add olive oil and fry for about 3-5 minutes. Season to taste and enjoy with plantains and sweet potatoes
Notes
You want your plantains to look like this and soft to the touch ( not mushy) When fried, you get that nice surface crisp with each bite.

[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/herb-baked-potatoes-and-plantains.jpg?resize=1119%2C1679&ssl=1]
A platter like this will definitely keep your guess returning for more.
This simple sauce brings everything together. "Planty and pepper" like we say. So simple , sometimes I make a batch and refrigerate for about a week or more. You can go as spicy as you want. Some sweet onions, peppers and fresh herbs. Its that easy. You'll find yourself enjoying the sauce with a lot more .
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/herb-baked-sweet-potatoes-and-friend-plantains.jpg?resize=1280%2C1755&ssl=1]
Plantains are so versatile. You can season them up however you want prior to frying! Here I used Essiespice Mekko Dry Rub . Other options include, ginger , garlic, paprika, onion powder ad so much more. Endless options. A plantain dish of some sort always makes it to the dinner table when I have friends coming over. You can never go wrong with sweet fried ripe plantains. Try this one, and don't forget to share what you're cooking from the afrovitalityeats kitchen.
HERB BAKED SWEET POTATOES AND PLANTAINS
Ingredients
- 4 medium sweet potatoes
- 2 Tbsp packed minced parsley
- 1 Tbsp minced garlic
- 1 Tbsp Basil Olive oil
- a pinch of salt
Plantains
- 3 large ripe plantains
- 1 Tbsp essie spice mekko dry rub
- 2 pinches of kosher salt
Pepper sauce
- 2 small scotch bonnet peppers ((or habanero-more for a hotter sauce))
- 4 garlic cloves
- 2 sprigs Of parsley
- 1 small green onion
- 4 roma tomatoes
- 1-2 Tbsp olive oil
- 1 small sweet onion
Instructions
potatoes
1. Preheat oven to 375
2. Wash, peel and cut potatoes into wedges. Set into a cool water bath to prevent browning. Once done, drain and pat dry with a kitchen towel.
3. Transfer into a bowl large enough to toss. Add in olive oil, parsley, garlic, salt and toss. Transfer to a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake at 375 for about 25 minutes until golden brown. Flip wedges about 15 minutes into baking. Serve immediately with sauce
Plantains
1. Wash peel and slice plantains as shown.Combine with mekko dry rub into a large bowl and toss well.
2. Heat oil to about 360-375 degrees. Fry plantains until golden brown. Transfer unto a paper towel to drain excess oil. You can toss with more of the dry rub after frying. Garnish with fresh parsley and Serve with pepper sauce.
Pepper Sauce
1. Blend all ingredients with about 3/4 cup of water and transfer to a sauce pot
2. Bring to a a gentle simmer and cook for about 20 minutes until contents reduce into a thick sauce. Add olive oil and fry for about 3-5 minutes. Season to taste and enjoy with plantains and sweet potatoes
Notes
You want your plantains to look like this and soft to the touch ( not mushy) When fried, you get that nice surface crisp with each bite.

Text:
Garlic thyme Chicken Salad with Couscous
Easter Brunch
Simple Easter Salad! This Garlic thyme Chicken Salad is definitely celebratory. This Easter Sunday we sure have plenty to celebrate. Last Easter, I was holding my little girl for the first time. This year, it is way too early for her birthday but I will always Celebrate her being born on Easter Sunday.
Today, not only do we want an easy and quick lunch, we also want to kick our feet up, do nothing, watch movies and call it a Sunday. That's they should be. Relax! Sundays and not call it a rest day.
That being said, we wanted a head start on lunch. While in church , this chicken was sitting in a simple garlic thyme marinade. You ever try taking an 11 month old to mass? Ahhhhh, I see all these parents, holding their very "chill" little babies. Lets Just say my husband spent part of the service entertaining our little girl outside.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/Garlic-thyme-chicken-couscous-salad.jpg?resize=1280%2C1745&ssl=1]
A simple salad.
Chicken is tender and juicy.
And it is a breeze to prepare once you get that chicken well marinated. Definitely one to add unto your list of healthy , hearty salads. You can make it a main course even for vegans. Skip the chicken and maybe substitute with tofu, tempeh or some vegan sausage. You can also increase your couscous portion to make it more filling. If you do try this one do let me know how It turns out.
GARLIC THYME CHICKEN SALAD WITH COUSCOUS
Prep Time: 15 minutes mins, Cook Time: 25 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 3 pieces of chicken breasts ((Skinless))
- 3 large Garlic cloves ((grated))
- 3 sprigs Of fresh thyme ((Wash and destem))
- 1/2-1 tsp Kosher salt
Couscous
- 3/4 cup couscous
- 1/4 cup crushed dry roasted peanuts ((lightly salted))
- 1 Tbsp dried cranberries
- 2 pinches of garlic powder
- 2 pinches of black pepper
Salad & Dressing
- 4 handfulls of mixed greens
- 2-3 Tbsp safflower oil
- 1 Tsp dijon mustard
- 1/2 Tbsp raw honey
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 Tbsp lemon juice
- 1 medium avocado sliced
Instructions
1. Rinse and pad dry chicken. Add in thyme, garlic and salt. Mix well to get every area of the chicken covered. Cover with saran wrap and refrigerate for about an hour. Remove from fridge, let sit on the counter while you preheat the oven and prep other ingredients.
2. Preheat Oven to 350
3. Heat cast iron skillet over medium to high heat. Add about 1/2 a tablespoon of olive oil to pan (Enough to coat the pan). Sear chicken on each side until nice brown( About 2-3 minutes). Transfer to oven and bake for 7 minutes ( Or until juices run clear and chicken is completely cooked). Let Rest while you build your salad
4. Cook couscous according to package directions. After fluffing, add in all remaining couscous ingredients and toss together. Add salt to taste if necessary.
5. For dressing whisk olive oil, lemon juice, mustard and honey until you get a homogenous mixture. season to taste with salt and pepper.
6. To build you salad, toss salad greens with dressing. Transfer to a salad bowl. Top with couscous , avocado and sliced chicken. Drizzle a little more dressing over the whole bowl and enjoy.

Text:
Game day oven baked chicken wings and plantains
Game day oven baked chicken wings and plantains! Sometimes you just want to gather with your favorite pals, turn on the TV and be loud. Be it game day or lifetime movies ( I can't remember the last time I watched a lifetime movie). You just want great company, people you love being around and forget you have something going on the next day.
Nothing brings people together better than food. And these spicy wings and plantains is all you need. Crispy, tender and finger licking delicious.
In under forty five minutes you'll get every one ooooing and ahhhhing with their first bites. Do make a big platter if you can, I promise there will be no left overs.
The Simple dry rub for the chicken uses basic pantry ingredients and Essiespice Mekko Dry Rub. In the Absence of the dry rub, use a little more garlic powder, and half a teaspoon each of ginger and ground dry roasted peanuts.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/Grilled-Chicken-wings.jpg?resize=1280%2C1920&ssl=1]
Plantains
Simply fry them! You can grill for a healthier fare. Right off the fryer, toss a pinch or two of kosher salt for that sweet and salty wonder. You can use plantains at any level of ripeness, its just preference. For a sweeter taste, the skin will be yellow with some black spots. They turn to soak up a little more oil if they are too ripe. The best in my opinion is when they are just ripe and a little soft to the touch. You'll appreciate that crispy warm bite.
Grab some napkins and have at it. Nothing should come between you and this platter.
Be it a night in with the fellas or movie night with your gals; you sure will have something delicious to feast on. Make sure you try our game day oven baked chicken wings and plantain recipe. We would love to hear what else from the afrovitalityats kitchen makes it to your dining table.
GAME DAY OVEN BAKED CHICKEN WINGS AND PLANTAINS
Ingredients
- 1/2 pound chicken wings
- 1 tbsp canola oil
- 1/2 Tbsp mekko dry rub
- 1/2 tsp onion powder
- 1/2 tsp Garlic powder
- 1/2 tsp country onion
- 1/2 maggi cube
- 2 large ripe plantains
- 1/2 tsp Kosher salt
- oil for frying
- 3 Tbsp Vegenaise
- 1 Tbsp yellow mustard
- 1 Tbsp honey ginger balsamic vinegar
- 2 tsp lime juice
Instructions
1. Wash and pat dry chicken wings. Add in canola oil and all dried spices. Mix well and marinate for 10-15 minutes.
2. Preheat Oven to 450
3. Oil a cast iron skillet ( or any grill pan). Place chicken in single layer. Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden brown and skin is crispy
4. Serve with ripe plantains and your favorite dip.
Plantains
1. Wash, peel and slice plantains at an angle. Fry until golden brown and transfer to a kitchen towel to drain excess oil. Sprinkle some kosher salt. Serve warm.
Creamy mayo dip
1. combine, vegenaise, mustard, balsamic and lime juice in a bowl, whisk until creamy. Season to taste with salt. Serve with wings and plantains

Text:
Gimme Lean West African vegan meatballs
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2016/02/watermark635916761010639307.png?resize=1024%2C768]
It's been almost three years since my husband became a pescaterian and I must say it has been a welcomed challenge. Who would've thought the vegan aisle would be my first stop at the grocery store? Well nowadays, hunting for the next meat substitute is always on the agenda. Stumbled upon Lightlife vegan proteins and decided to give it a go. So hopefully this will be a meatless Monday inspiration for some of you out there.
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2016/02/watermark635916763341011146.png?resize=1024%2C768]
The texture is so meaty one could be tricked they just ate meat. They can go any direction you want and I plan on traveling the globe with the different flavor profiles. West Africa it is today.
- 14 oz Lightlife gimme lean veggie beef
- 1/4 cup finely chopped parsley
- 1 teaspoon minced onion
- 1 teaspoon minced garlic
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 3 tablespoon olive oil
- 15 oz hunts tomato sauce
- 1 cup crushed roma tomatoes
- 2/3 cup mild fresh herb blend
- 1/4 cup finely chopped onions.
- 1 teaspoon minced garlic
- salt to taste
- In a large skillet combine tomato sauce and crushed tomatoes. Bring to a gentle simmer and let cook for about 15 minutes.
- Meanwhile, combine all meatball ingredients in a bowl (Except oil), mix well and roll into 3/4-1 inch round pieces.
- Heat oil in a medium skillet and add meatballs. Cook, while gently rotating to a nice golden brown. Add onions and garlic, stir and cook for another minute.
- Transfer tomato mixture into meatball skillet. Add spice blend, stir and let simmer for about 10 minutes. Season to taste.
- Combine with pasta, mix well and serve or serve over pasta. Cook any pasta of your choice according to package direction

Text:
GOT (Garlic /Onion 'n Tomatoes) Eggs
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/watermark635815804749291365.png?resize=640%2C640]
Breakfast should never be boring, even if you're running late ( Like me most of the time). I refuse to skip breakfast, last resort will be running out the door with an oatmeal shake in hand! But never will I go hungry for any reason; that's just criminal.
This here is one of my quick leisurely breakfast ideas when I have a few minutes to spare. So simple there really isn't much to say about it other than boast about its simplicity.
Makes 2 Servings
INGREDIENTS
- 2 whole eggs
- 3 Roma tomatoes dices
- ¼ c thinly sliced red onions
- 2 garlic cloves crushed
- 1 Tbsp olive oil
- Salt and pepper to taste
- Parsley for garnish
INSTRUCTIONS
1. Heat oil in medium skillet, add in onions / garlic and cook for about 2 minutes. 2. Then add in tomatoes and cook for another 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. At this point season to taste with salt and pepper 3. Finally add eggs, do not break the yolks. Cover and cook for ~ 5 minutes or until whites are completely cooked. 4. Plate, garnish with parsley and enjoy this easy, yet delightful breakfast. Can be served with toast, waffles or pancakes!

Text:
Goat Meat stew with cocoyams
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/IMG_4206-2.jpg?resize=778%2C987&ssl=1]
This hearty goat meat stew is just what we need with these unusually cold weather. A little something different and such a great twist to this stew. When you think of stew most will imagine potatoes and all else that comes with it. Well today, we are going with coco yams.
Coco yams ( Taro)
These starchy roots are common in Cameroon. Sometimes we boil them, skin on, peel and pound into a smooth dough called fufu. We serve this with a traditional palm oil soup in a dish called Achu. Another staple we enjoy with coco yams is a spicy pottage made with palm oil, crayfish and other spices. I must say this stew is a first with coco yams adding a much needed substance to the dish. There are different kinds of coco yams, these have a little redness to the flesh when peeled. You can check this by snapping a little end from the root when buying. These will bake and do a little better in the stew than the white ones. You can find these at an African or Asian grocery store.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/IMG_4232.jpg?resize=1920%2C1280&ssl=1]
Preparing Coco Yams
Double wash, this is optional. Wash, then peel off the skin to reveal the white flesh. Wash this again before slicing into chunks for boiling. Coco yams contain chemicals that will cause severe itching when raw and under cooked. Wear gloves during second wash or peeling. Add enough water to completely submerge coco yams and about and inch over, add salt and cook until soft. Drizzle some olive oil, some white pepper, toss and broil until they just start to char. These are amazing in the stew or just to snack on.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/IMG_4231.jpg?resize=1280%2C1853&ssl=1]
The goat meat we use here is the frozen left overs from the Christmas crowd. We were granted a one day pass to the restaurant depot and we couldn't pass on the amazing halal goat meat deal. Matter of fact, I still have quite a bit left for future use. A little tip from my mother this holiday is applied to this dish. With goat meat , we usually enjoy some goat meat pepper soup. It is best to add in your spices and cook for a little while before adding water. This lets your meat absorb the seasoning that short cook time. The meat releases some water as it cooks. Water is then added and gently simmered for about two hours until the meat is tender.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/IMG_4233.jpg?resize=1280%2C1804&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/IMG_4230.jpg?resize=1280%2C1870&ssl=1]
Your meat is tender and you have an amazing broth to go with it. All you need is to make you tomato base and you are ready to enjoy one filling stew for any starving belly. Roma style tomatoes are my favorite. I guess a bag of frozen mixed vegetable cab be much more than steamed veggies.
You prefer beef? Easy substitute, you need not change anything. This is now a regular at home especially on cold days. So comforting and satisfying. I hope this dish makes a debut in your home. And this might just be a guest that will definitely over stay and you'll enjoy every bit of the company.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/IMG_4209-1.jpg?resize=1200%2C1670&ssl=1]
GOAT MEAT STEW WITH COCOYAMS
Prep Time: 20 minutes mins, Cook Time: 2 hours hrs
Ingredients
- ~1 pound bone in goat meat
- 3 small coco yams
- 1 cup crushed roma style tomatoes
- 1/2 cup mixed vegetables ((corn, carrots and peas))
- 1/2 cup Chopped celery
- 1 medium onion sliced
- 5 garlic cloves grated
- 1 small scotch bonnet
- 1/2 tbsp grated ginger
- 3 inch lenght Leeks (Green part)
- 4-5 cups of water
- a pinch white pepper
- 2-3 Tbsp of olive oil
- salt & maggie to taste
Instructions
1. Wash peel and cut coco yams into small chunks. Rinse again, transfer into a pot, cover with water, season with salt as boil until tender ( about 15-20 minutes depending on the size). Strain and transfer to a baking sheet. Drizzle some olive oil and black pepper and broil on high until they edges are a tiny bit charred. Set Aside.
2. Meanwhile, wash goat meat and transfer to a medium skillet or sauce pan. Add in 1/4 portion of the sliced onion, salt, maggi, garlic and ginger. Cove and cook on medium heat until met starts to release some water. Simmer for another 5-7 minutes. Then add in 4 cups of water, reduce heat and continue to simmer for about 2 hours until meat is tender. Your broth should be a little over a cup. Remove and strain, separating meat from broth.
3. Rinse and wipe skillet. Heat oil and brown goat meat , about 2-3 minutes. Remove and set aside. In the same pot add in 1/2 portion of the sliced onions. Cook for about 3 minutes, then add in crushed tomatoes. This will deglaze you pan. Cover and let simmer for 10 minutes.
4. Blend remaining onions with leeks and scotch bonnet pepper. Add into skillet together with broth , goat meat, celery , mixed veggies and broiled coco yams. Cover and simmer for another 10 minutes until vegetables are tender. (Add water if its too thick)
5. Adjust for seasoning and enjoy.

Add enough water to completely submerge coco yams and about and inch over, add salt and cook until soft. Drizzle some olive oil, some white pepper, toss and broil until they just start to char. These are amazing in the stew or just to snack on.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/IMG_4231.jpg?resize=1280%2C1853&ssl=1]
The goat meat we use here is the frozen left overs from the Christmas crowd. We were granted a one day pass to the restaurant depot and we couldn't pass on the amazing halal goat meat deal. Matter of fact, I still have quite a bit left for future use. A little tip from my mother this holiday is applied to this dish. With goat meat , we usually enjoy some goat meat pepper soup. It is best to add in your spices and cook for a little while before adding water. This lets your meat absorb the seasoning that short cook time. The meat releases some water as it cooks. Water is then added and gently simmered for about two hours until the meat is tender.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/IMG_4233.jpg?resize=1280%2C1804&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/IMG_4230.jpg?resize=1280%2C1870&ssl=1]
Your meat is tender and you have an amazing broth to go with it. All you need is to make you tomato base and you are ready to enjoy one filling stew for any starving belly. Roma style tomatoes are my favorite. I guess a bag of frozen mixed vegetable cab be much more than steamed veggies.
You prefer beef? Easy substitute, you need not change anything. This is now a regular at home especially on cold days. So comforting and satisfying. I hope this dish makes a debut in your home. And this might just be a guest that will definitely over stay and you'll enjoy every bit of the company.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/01/IMG_4209-1.jpg?resize=1200%2C1670&ssl=1]
GOAT MEAT STEW WITH COCOYAMS
Prep Time: 20 minutes mins, Cook Time: 2 hours hrs
Ingredients
- ~1 pound bone in goat meat
- 3 small coco yams
- 1 cup crushed roma style tomatoes
- 1/2 cup mixed vegetables ((corn, carrots and peas))
- 1/2 cup Chopped celery
- 1 medium onion sliced
- 5 garlic cloves grated
- 1 small scotch bonnet
- 1/2 tbsp grated ginger
- 3 inch lenght Leeks (Green part)
- 4-5 cups of water
- a pinch white pepper
- 2-3 Tbsp of olive oil
- salt & maggie to taste
Instructions
1. Wash peel and cut coco yams into small chunks. Rinse again, transfer into a pot, cover with water, season with salt as boil until tender ( about 15-20 minutes depending on the size). Strain and transfer to a baking sheet. Drizzle some olive oil and black pepper and broil on high until they edges are a tiny bit charred. Set Aside.
2. Meanwhile, wash goat meat and transfer to a medium skillet or sauce pan. Add in 1/4 portion of the sliced onion, salt, maggi, garlic and ginger. Cove and cook on medium heat until met starts to release some water. Simmer for another 5-7 minutes. Then add in 4 cups of water, reduce heat and continue to simmer for about 2 hours until meat is tender. Your broth should be a little over a cup. Remove and strain, separating meat from broth.
3. Rinse and wipe skillet. Heat oil and brown goat meat , about 2-3 minutes. Remove and set aside. In the same pot add in 1/2 portion of the sliced onions. Cook for about 3 minutes, then add in crushed tomatoes. This will deglaze you pan. Cover and let simmer for 10 minutes.
4. Blend remaining onions with leeks and scotch bonnet pepper. Add into skillet together with broth , goat meat, celery , mixed veggies and broiled coco yams. Cover and simmer for another 10 minutes until vegetables are tender. (Add water if its too thick)
5. Adjust for seasoning and enjoy.

Text:
Grilled Salmon salad with Romaine and yellow beets
This simple grilled salmon salad with romaine lettuce and yellow beets is fresh, light and super easy to make. When your local market is running a ridiculously amazing sockeye salmon deal you tell yourself its time for an upgrade! The deal was too good to pass on, hence the inspiration for a quick salad.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Simple-Salmon-Salad.jpg?resize=1643%2C1280&ssl=1]
With the deal they had going my main goal was to stock up, deals like this are rare. My thoughts when I left work?
" They better not be sold out! "
Lucky for me, they had some left. So while I seasoned some for this quick salad, the rest was sliced and frozen for future use. Why on earth will I freeze all and not experience the premium quality of wild caught sockeye salmon eh?
Refrain from doing too much with this beauty. Sometimes we tend to over do it. I kept things really simple with just some kosher salt, Tuscan herb olive oil and some black pepper. Its flavor is too good to overshadow with so many unnecessary spices or what not.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Salmon.jpg?resize=1839%2C1280&ssl=1]
So all I did was let it marinade for a few minutes and it was off to the grill pan. The pieces were about half inch thick so it cooked in little to no time. A couple of minutes on each side and it was good to go. That being said "mis en place" is critically, unless you want your salmon all dried out because you are rushing to build the salad, whip up the vinaigrette, set the table and everything else. So build your salad and make your vinaigrette before grilling.
Decided to go for yellow beets not just for the nutritional value and beautiful color but as silly as it sounds, I wasn't ready for stained red hands! They actually seem a little easier to peel too. Made thin shavings of the beets which also added a nice crunch to the salad. Not quite sure if it was my lucky day for fresh finds but the head of romaine lettuce was ginormous and super crisp. Just what I was on the hunt for. Also added some sweet grape tomatoes and pitted kalamata olives ( Sockeye got me thinking outside the box)
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Quick-Salmon-Salad.jpg?resize=1518%2C1280&ssl=1]
A simple vinaigrette using two of my favorites, Persian lime olive oil and honey ginger balsamic worked perfectly with this salad. You are obviously not tied to this, so feel free to try with your favorite salad dressing.
So here is to simple grilled salmon salad with romaine and yellow beets that might just safe your work week!
GRILLED SALMON SALAD WITH ROMAINE AND YELLOW BEETS
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 5 minutes mins
Ingredients
For the Salmon
- 1/2 lb Sockeye salmon (sliced about 1/2 inch thick)
- ~ 1 Tbsp Tuscan Olive oil
- 1/4 tsp Kosher salt
For the Salad
- 1 medium yellow beet (peeled and shaved into thin slices)
- 2 large romaine lettuce leaves (roughly sliced)
- 1/2 cup grape tomatoes (sliced in halves)
- 1/4 cup kalamata olives ((optional))
Honey ginger balsamic vinaigrette
- 1/2 Tbsp shallots (finely diced)
- 1 Tbsp minced parsley (packed)
- 1 Tbsp Honey ginger balsamic
- 3 Tbsp Persian lime olive oil
- 1 tsp lemon juice
- salt/pepper taste
Instructions
1. Season salmon with salt and completely coat pieces with olive oil. Set aside.
2. Build salad, starting with lettuce, then top with beets , tomatoes and olive.
3. Combine all vinaigrette ingredients in a bowl and whisk. Refrigerate salad and vinaigrette while you grill salmon.
4. Preheat grill pan over medium heat, drizzle some oil and grill salmon on each side for about two minutes. Remove from heat
5. Top salad with grilled salmon, spoon vinaigrette over salad and serve.
Notes
Olives can be substituted with capers.

Text:
GREENHOUSE PROTEIN SMOOTHIE
Rise and shine with this hearty greenhouse protein smoothie loaded with the right ingredients to kickstart your day. Green smoothies do not have to be boring! Whether you're zooming out the door or seating on your back porch enjoying the sunshine, smoothies are one of the most convenient breakfasts eats.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/01/green-smoothie..jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
INGREDIENTS FOR GREENHOUSE POWER SMOOTHIE
- Spinach : Rich in vitamins A, C, and K, as well as iron, calcium, and fiber, spinach is the perfect base for green smoothies. Add as much as you'd like handful or more goes a long way to provide nutrients that promote healthy skin, support immunity, and aid in digestion.
- Banana : Brings in some natural sweetness and creaminess to our smoothie. They are an excellent source of potassium, which may help regulate blood pressure and other bodily functions. You're getting a well needed energy boost from these.
- Matcha Powder : Rich in antioxidants, Matcha powder, made from finely ground green tea leaves brings in some earthiness and vibrancy to our smoothie. It also adds in a little dose of caffeine, granting that energy boost without the jitters like coffee.
- Hemp Protein : An excellent protein source for all dietary preferences, providing a well-balanced and complete amino acid profile to keep you satiated longer. This is what transforms your average smoothie into a meal.
- Oat Milk : A dairy-free liquid Base Oat milk that is friendly and delicious for all. Whether you're vegan, lactose intolerant or have some dairy sensitivities, oat milk is an excellent base for smoothies. Rich in vitamins and minerals like vitamin D and calcium, and a good source of fiber
MAKE IT YOUR OWN
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/chia-seeds-bowl.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/peanut-butter-homemade.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/12/lemons.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
Ingredients for our greenhouse power smoothie are carefully curated to provide what you need for a balanced light meal, but you have room to do more. Here are a few variations you can try.
More Fruit : If you like your smoothies sweeter, bring in some more fruits for that and also the fiber. Try some oranges, pineapple and mango chunks for that tropical feel.
Nut Butters : Bring in a little more protein and creaminess with your favorite nut butters. Cashew and almond butter are our favorites, but you can also use peanut butter.
Chia seeds : A welcomed boost in omega-3 fatty acid and fiber. To note, this will slightly thicken your smoothie so adjust your liquid base accordingly.
Start or conclude your day with this nutritious greenhouse protein smoothie. With an abundance of vitamins, antioxidants, minerals and more, your whole being will be thankful you made that decision. Her e is a HIGH PROTEIN OATMEAL SMOOTHIE you can also enjoy.
GREENHOUSE PROTEIN SMOOTHIE
Kick start your day with this hearty greenhouse protein smoothie loaded with ingredients carefully curated for a balanced light meal.
Prep Time: 4 minutes mins, Cook Time: 1 minute min
Ingredients
- 2 Cups of Baby Spinach Leaves
- 1 small ripe banana ((about a cup))
- 1/2 tsp Matcha Powder
- 1 Tbsp hulled Hemp Hearts
- 1 and 1/2 cup lightly sweetened oat milk (( more or less as preferred))
Instructions
1. Transfer all ingredients into a blender and blend until smooth.
2. Serve immediately as is or over ice

Text:
Grilled Spicy Tuna Sandwich
This Grilled spicy tuna sandwich is super easy to make and packed with loads of flavor! Brunching at home is such a fun venture when simple ingredients become much more.
There are some days when a soup and sandwich is all what you need. When you tell you tell yourself, "I'll pay $15 for that!", then you know its not your average tuna sandwich. You probably have everything you need for this recipe around your kitchen, so trust me when I say its and easy quick go-to lunch idea. I used Essiespice Mango Chili Medley for that much needed zippy bite. Being an apartment dueler in the middle of winter in Wisconsin, my stove top grill gave it the perfect crunch.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/02/Grilled-Spicy-Tuna-Sandwich.jpg?resize=2430%2C2264&ssl=1]
GRILLED SPICY TUNA SANDWICH
Simple Grilled Spicy Tuna Sandwich with Essiespice Mango Chili Medley
Prep Time: 5 minutes mins, Cook Time: 5 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 4 slices Sourdough Bread
- 2 5 oz Starkist Chunklight Tuna in water
- 1 Tbsp Vegenaise
- 1/2 tsp dijon mustard
- 1/4 tsp horseradish
- 1/2 tsp Essiespice Mango Chili Medley
- 2 Slices Colby Jack Cheese
- 1 Roma Tomato Thinly sliced
- a handful of salad greens
Instructions
1. Preheat stove top grill to low medium heat
2. Open and strain tuna to get rig of excess water. Combine with mustard, chili medley, horseradish and vegenaise and mix well.
3. To build sandwich, divide tuna mixture equally and spread over bottom slice of bread. Top with cheese, tomato, then salad greens. Close with top piece,
4. Lightly grease grill with PAM spray. Grill sandwich on each side until crunchy with some slightly charred grilled marks.
5. Slice and serve with soup of choice.

Text:
GUIDE TO LONG LASTING SALAD GREENS
This season we are sharing our simple guide to long lasting salad greens. With their vibrant colors and refreshing crunch, greens are a staple in salads, sandwiches, wraps and more. However, most of us are not lucky enough to truly enjoy the farm-fresh goodness we need because they rut before you blink. Ready to enjoy those salad greens for up to 10 days? This is our true and tested way to long lasting salad greens while maintaining freshness. No one wants that rut and you do not have to eat all your greens in a day to avoid the waste!
HOW TO BUY THE FRESH SALAD GREENS
How fresh are the greens you're starting with? Yes, I do grab the salad packet from the back, because that sell by date is very close if not the same as the use by date. Don't rush for that $3 off deal with greens you can't even consume. Make sure the use by date is at least 5 days. Take a look at the packet and ensure there is no discoloration or sliminess.
If you do grow some lettuce and salad greens this season, here are a few things we do to ensure we are starting with the freshest salad greens.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/butter-lettuce.jpg?resize=768%2C1024&ssl=1]
WHEN AND HOW TO HARVEST LETTUCE FOR OPTIMAL FRESHNESS
Harvesting your lettuce early in the morning ensures you get that perfectly hydrated crunchy greens. To ensure continuous harvest throughout the season, cut outer leaves just above the soil and save the new growth. If you're at the end of the season, you can pull the entire head of lettuce from the soil. You'll need to thoroughly wash and dry the greens before storing.
TIPS FOR WASHING LETTUCE AND SALAD GREENS
If we are pulling out the entire plant, start by cutting off the root system with a knife or sheer. Then fill up a large bucket or kitchen sink with enough water to wash greens. Gently swirl or shake around to dislodge any remaining dirt. Discard water and repeat two to three times. You can use a vegetable cleaning agent (vinegar is an option) or not. Add an ounce into a bucket of water or kitchen sink with enough water to rinse. Soak for a few minutes and thoroughly rinse checking between leaves for any remaining traces of dirt or bugs. Rinse one final time with clean water.
DRYING LETTUCE
Thoroughly drying your lettuce impacts how long they'll store. You can use a salad spinner or dry on some clean kitchen towels. Feel free to use a fan to keep the air moving and speed the drying process. You can also flip the leaves over to ensure they are completely dry before you store.
HOW TO STORE LETTUCE AND OTHER SALAD GREENS TO MAINTAIN FRESHNESS
With our harvest, we had enough greens for at least 10 servings of lettuce.
Zip Lock bags . Place a paper towel in the bag and then add your salad greens. Seal , while getting rid of as much air as you can from the bag without bruising the greens. The paper towel absorbs moisture and prevents rut. This will keep fresh in the crisper section of your refrigerator for up to 10 days if need be.
Large bowl with a tight lid . Start with a paper towel at the bottom, then add your greens. Top with another paper towel before sealing. Do not over pack as you might bruise the greens. This keeps in the refrigerator for up to 10 days.
Also make sure your refrigerator is the optimal temp of 37 F. Too cold or too warm will speed spoilage and damage the greens.
With this simple guide to long lasting salad greens, you'll be enjoying those salad greens for much longer and maintain that garden fresh appeal. Grow or buy right, clean appropriately and enjoy long lasting salad greens!
Now try this Orzo Shrimp Romaine Lettuce salad with those crisp greens!

Large bowl with a tight lid . Start with a paper towel at the bottom, then add your greens. Top with another paper towel before sealing. Do not over pack as you might bruise the greens. This keeps in the refrigerator for up to 10 days.
Also make sure your refrigerator is the optimal temp of 37 F. Too cold or too warm will speed spoilage and damage the greens.
With this simple guide to long lasting salad greens, you'll be enjoying those salad greens for much longer and maintain that garden fresh appeal. Grow or buy right, clean appropriately and enjoy long lasting salad greens!
Now try this Orzo Shrimp Romaine Lettuce salad with those crisp greens!

Text:
Happy hour African Salmon sliders w/ spicy mayo spread
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2016/02/watermark635907280583983153.png?resize=1022%2C768]
It's 5:30 pm on Friday, the weekend is young! You've had a long week and can't wait to have a good time with friends, or retreat and have some alone time with your significant other (Or by yourself). Whatever option you choose, find some inner joy and get some rest because Monday is around the corner, make the weekend count. Tuck your phone away, share some laughs, drinks and a good meal with friends.
This Friday evening was a chill one with some happy hour favorites right at home. My husband, God bless his heart ferments everything!!! Thanks to him, there is always a delicious home-brew chilling in the fridge, some homemade yogurt and now some very fizzy yummy kombucha to savor. Happy hour at home featured an English Style Bitter (ESB) and some salmon sliders bursting with flavors from home. Still trying to master some beer / food pairings but I think they complemented one another wonderfully.
Picked up some salmon fillets, fresh pretzel buns and other condiments from our local market on my way back from work and couldn't wait to get home and officially start the weekend. So let the music play, pour me a drink and let's cook together. It's happy hour at home
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2016/02/watermark635907278962825579_edited1.jpg?resize=886%2C665]
Salmon was seasoned with Essiespice Meko Dry rub ( West African Spice Blend) which definitely enhanced the beautiful flavors of this fish. West-African cuisine is gaining more exposure and this fills my heart with joy. I remember going to half-price bookstore a few years back to explore some cookbooks. It was disheartening to realize there was not ONE book on the shelve focused on West -African Cuisine! Now I see books popping up on amazon, and e-books from amazing food bloggers :-).
Back to cooking. This recipe is super easy to replicate. Oh and our happy hour at home amounted to less than $10! for two......... Salmon was pan-seared with harissa infused olive oil. Then roughly shredded before building the sliders.
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2016/02/watermark635907279870483657.png?resize=1024%2C768]
Valentine's day weekend is around the corner and my three course valentine's day dinner will feature this recipe in appetizer portions. Happy Valentine's Day weekend, stay blessed!
