They are super easy to make , quick and delicious. Hands on time is about 20 minutes depending on how much you are making. They are the perfect bite sized dish to take to parties and other gatherings. Teatime just got better so do pair this with a warm cup of chai or coffee. Very airy on the inside making it light even though it is fried. Blame me not for how many you end up eating but do make sure you make enough to share.
PUMPKIN SPICE PUFF PUFF
Airy pumpkin spice puff puff to celebrate Autumn and the upcoming holiday season. Notes of cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice.
Prep Time: 5 minutes mins, Cook Time: 15 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 1 and 1/2 cup Unbleached all purpose flour
- 1 and 1/2 tsp dry yeast
- 1/4 cup brown sugar (lightly packed)
- 1/2 tsp Cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp Allspice
- 1/4 tsp Nutmeg
- 1/2 tsp Vanilla
- pinch of Salt
- 1 Cup Warm water
Instructions
1. Combine all dry ingredients in a mixing bowl and whisk until combined.
2. Slowly add water while whisking until smooth with no lumps.
3. Seal bowl with saran wrap and store in a warm area for 45 minutes or until double
4. Heat oil 325 to 350 degrees Fahrenheit in fryer or large frying pan. Test with a dough drop to ensure oil is just right. Then scoop dough with hands or spoon and carefully drop in oil. Fry on each side until golden brown and fully cooked inside.
5. Remove and place on paper towel to drain excess oil.
6. If desired, transfer into a bowl with granulated sugar and toss to coat. Enjoy

Text:
Poulet DG Camerounais
Poulet, is the French word for Chicken. DG stands for "Directeur Général" Direct translation for this dish reads Director General Chicken. It's one of those dishes saved for special guests. In fact, I still reserve it for special occasion, in my case dinner at home with some good company. Sometimes I brood over what made it so special such that it graced mom's dinner table only when my father's work colleagues were coming over.
She's off to the market bright and early for the freshest herbs, spices and vegetables. We knew it's an even bigger event when she comes home without the chicken. That means she is using one of ours. The aroma from every single step of the cooking process had me lingering around the kitchen , waiting to taste along. It really was a dish for the big boss back then but it should definitely be savored by all.
Poulet DG
Traditional we use the whole chicken for Poulet DG, but today I'll be using mainly boneless chicken thighs. Don't you just love the smell of fresh spices and herbs?! Leeks, celery, parsley and more. I always have a blend of fresh herbs stored in ice cube trays in the freezer. They always come in handy.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/poulet-Dj-SPICES.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/POLET-DJ-BLENDED-SPICES-e1533828694709-683x1024.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
Stir in a portion of the blended spices with the chicken, season with salt, maggi or bouillon, adding no water. Simmer for a few minutes , letting the chicken soak up the spices before adding water, creating another layer of wonderful flavors. We are reserving this stock for the sauce. The chicken is then fried (just like the plantains) but I will pan sear and brown on each side. I used boneless chicken thigh because chicken breasts tend to dry out easily.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/POULET-DJ-CHICKEN.jpg?resize=682%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/POULET-DG-BROWNED-CHICKEN.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
Shopping for plantains
Plantains are probably one of my favorite things. You can find plantains at most grocery stores, they are similar to bananas but are bigger in size, have a thicker skin and should be cooked before eating. Here the semi-ripe plantain gives this dish the perfect sweetness and a nice texture with each bite. How long it takes plantains to be ripe enough for this dish will depend on temperature, storage conditions and other environmental factors. It takes about 2-3 days for green plantains to become appropriately ripe for this dish. There should be no dark spots on the skin (too ripe). Refrigeration will slow things down if you plan on using them at a later day.
Stop by your local market and gather these fresh ingredients. This dish may have been reserved for the elite but not anymore. One of my favorites to make for sunday lunch with the family.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/Poulet-DG-ingredients.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/POULET-DJ-PLANTAIN.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/POULET-DJ-BAKED-PLANTAIN.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/POULET-DJ-CARROTS.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/POULET-DJ-MIX.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/08/POULET-DJ-CAMEROUNAISE.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
POULET DG CAMEROUNAISE
Flavorful one pan plantain and chicken special from Cameroon with lots of fresh herbs , vegetables and spices.
Prep Time: 20 minutes mins, Cook Time: 45 minutes mins
Ingredients
- ~ 1lb boneless chicken thighs ((Skin on or skin off))
- 3 medium semi ripe plantains
- 2 medium Roma Tomatoes diced ((~1 and 1/2 cup))
- 1 large Yellow Onions ((1/2 sliced, 1/2 to be blended ))
- 3 medium bell peppers (green/red/yellow) (sliced)
- 1 large carrot sliced into rings ((~1 cup ))
- 2 sprigs Of parsley
- 1/4 inch chunk of ginger
- 2 inch Leeks (Green part)
- salt to taste
- 2-3 Tbsp canola oil
Instructions
Plantains
1. Wash peel and slice plantains into half inch thick rings. Toss with some olive oil and spread in a single layer on a greased cookie sheet. Broil on each side until they are just brown. Set Aside (You can also fry the plantains)
Poulet DG
1. Trim off excess fat from chicken thighs, rinse well and transfer into a sauce pan. Blend 1/2 of the onions with all other spices/ herbs and a little bit of water into a thick puree. Add half of this puree into the saucepan containing the chicken, season with some salt (Or chicken bouillon). Bring to a gentle simmer and cook for about 7 minutes. Then add in 1 cup and a half of water. Continue to simmer for another 10-15 minutes. Strain and set stock aside.
2. Heat oil in a large/ deep skillet and brown chicken on each side. Remove and set aside. Add a little more oil in the same pan and saute onions for about 3 minutes. Add in tomatoes and carrots and cook until carrots are almost to your desired tenderness. Add peppers, the reserved chicken stock, remaining spice blend, 1/2 cup of water and plantains. Season to taste and cook until peppers are tender
3. Finally add chicken, mix well and cook for another 5 minutes. Add a little more stock or water if you like a little more sauce.
4. Enjoy

Text:
Pumpkin spice Chin Chin
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/chin-chin-gift-wrap.jpg?resize=1093%2C1639&ssl=1]
Pumpkin Spice chin chin. Full disclaimer, these are addictive! The have the perfect crunch and are deliciously bad for you. Just want to get it out there before we proceed.
Growing up , these treats are reserved strictly for the holidays, particularly Christmas. It was our tradition and I still remember how excited we all were when shopping for the ingredients. We all huddled around my mom , watching each step closely. Definitely not because we cared about learning. More like looking for the right moment to sneak in a bite of the dough. She usually rolls out the dough and have us cut it into our favorite shapes. We got creative for sure but little squares are the way to go.
Christmas in Cameroon
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/chin-chin-gift-.jpg?resize=682%2C1024&ssl=1]
As a child , it is customary for us to visit as many neighbors as we can on Christmas day. As a matter of fact we did not open presents. Probably because we already had them on. NEW CLOTHES AND SHOES! That was our gift every year. Things are different in America for sure when it comes to the holidays and the concept of "gift".
By the end of the day, you best believe there were soup stains and what not on those brand new dresses. We ate something at every stop and chin chin was definitely an item on the menu.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/pumpkin-spice-chin-chin.jpg?fit=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
Pumpkin Spice
Usually chin chin is made with nutmeg. Once I discovered I did not have nutmeg the idea to use Pumpkin spice is the next best option. That being said you can definitely branch out and try new things. I actually added a little bit of cinnamon too. Add in whatever screams the holiday spirit for you.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/chin-chin-packets.jpg?resize=705%2C1024&ssl=1]
Caption: CHIN CHIN
MAKING CHIN CHIN
Sometimes I literally just throw in all my ingredients and mix. But as a great baker once told me, mix your dry ingredients and wet ingredients separately.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/chin-chin-flour-mix-1.jpg?fit=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/chin-chin-eggs-683x1024.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
Your dough after kneading should be somewhat elastic
Fun part! roll out and cut into your favorite shapes. It could even be a teaching moment with you little one. Triangles, squares, rectangles.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/Chin-Chin.jpg?resize=682%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/chin-chin-cuts.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
When ready, heat oil and fry until golden brown. Let cool and enjoy. Like I mentioned earlier, these are deliciously bad for you. But eh, there is only one Christmas a year so I'm sure your fitfam will cut you some slacks.
Will be gifting my neighbors these this holiday season. You may not have time to mail out a batch to someone special but I hope you make some for yourself. Sometimes we do owe ourselves a guilty pleasure. This year, I am going for this delicious, crunchy pumpkin spice chin chin.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/chin-chin-gifts.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
CHRISTMAS CHIN CHIN
These pumpkin spice chin chin are addictive, crunchy and definitely a holiday tradition for us.
Prep Time: 45 minutes mins, Cook Time: 20 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 3 cups all purpose flour
- 1 7.6fl oz nestle media crema ((or 225ml of milk: whole, 2% , 1% or skim))
- 2 and 1/2 Tablespoon unsalted butter ((softenned))
- 1 medium egg
- 3/4 cup of granulated sugar
- 1/2 tsp baking powder
- 1/2 tsp pumpkin spice
- 1/2 tsp cinnamon
- canola oil for frying
Instructions
1. Combine and stir, flour, sugar, baking powder, pumpkin spice and cinnamon in a medium to large mixing bowl. Mix in softened butter.
2. Then crack in egg, and add milk. Use hands and mix until it forms a dough. Transfer to a smooth surface dusted with flour (large chopping board or granite counter top) and knead for about 5 minutes until smooth. Dough at this point is somewhat elastic
3. Cut dough into four. Dust surface with a little flow. Use a rolling pin (or pasta machine) and roll out dough into a 1/4 to 1/5 inch thick. Cut into desired shapes. To make squares, cut down then across. Use knife or hands dusted with some flour to remove from surface
4. Heat oil in a large/ deep fry pan. Leave about 2 inches or more from surface to prevent oil from bubbling over during frying.
5. Fry until golden brown. Let cool and enjoy. Can store in air tight container.

Text:
PLANTAIN TAPÉ TAPÉ CAMEROON
Plantain tapé tapé, also known as tostones, patacones in Latin American and the Carribean is a crispy twice fried green plantain enjoyed in Cameroon. Warm, crispy bites with a pinch of salt enjoyed with your favorite dip or sauce. In Cameroon we enjoy it with a spicy pepper sauce . Simply delightful and you need just a few ingredients to make this.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/tostones-recipe.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
INGREDIENTS FOR PLANTAIN TAPÉ TAPÉ
Green Plantains : They have to be green to be crispy, with a little give once you take a bite. Slightly ripe or ripe plantains will soak up too much oil during the second fry, making them greasy. When buying plantains, make sure they are strong and firm.
Salt : This is all you'll need for seasoning. Add a sprinkle of some kosher salt before the second fry or right after frying.
Oil : These are deep fried, and you'll need to use oils with a high enough smoke point. Canola, soybean and avocado oil all have a smoke point over 400°F. We used canola oil.
PREPARE THE PLANTAINS
You'll find green plantains a little more challenging to peel than ripe plantains. For tapé tapé, plantains are cut into about 1-inch slices before frying. Rather than peeling the entire plantain before cutting, cut before you peel. Thoroughly wash, trim ends and then cut. Then make cuts along ridges until you reach the thick flesh. Use your thumb or paring knife to lift and peel off the skin. You can soak in water to prevent the skin from darkening if you're not frying right away but make sure it is completely dry before frying.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/plantain.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/cut-plantain.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
TO MAKE PLANTAIN TAPÉ TAPÉ
Once your plantains are peeled and cut, you'll start with the first fry. Oil should be at least 350°F. These are big cuts and you 'll fry for about 3 minutes. You want some color change and to partially cook enough to press right after frying. Use a tortilla press to smash the plantains. You can also use a mason jar, a plate, a flat wooden spoon, basically any food safe item that can smash plantains.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/tostones-recipes.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
Sprinkle a pinch of salt on both sides, return the smashed plantain back into the hot oil and fry again until golden brown and crispy. You can also salt right after the second fry. Remove and place on a paper towel to soak up any excess oil.
HOW TO SERVE
This is a great side dish, appetizer or snack. You can simply enjoy as is but here are a few ways we like to enjoy them.
Spicy Pepper Sauce : Some form of spicy sauce is always available at home and we use it as a dip with plantain tapé tapé. You can also serve with a mild sauce or your favorite dip.
Guacamole : Pairing with guac will make a great appetizer for gatherings.
Salsa : Bring in some tropical vibes. Use one to scoop up a hefty dose of mango salsa. Simply refreshing.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Tostones.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
We prefer to enjoy immediately but if you do have some leftovers, it's best reheated in the oven or air fryer. Preheat oven to 350 degrees and reheat for about 5 minutes or until they are crispy, then serve.
Plantain tapé tapé is simply delightful. You'll absolutely savor that first crispy bite but save some for others or at least make enough to share. Grab some green plantains and bring this to the table.
PLANTAIN TAPÉ TAPÉ CAMEROON
Plantain tapé tapé, savory crispy twice fried green plantains enjoyed with a pepper sauce or your favorite dipping sauce
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 10 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 2 large green plantains
- Canola oil for frying
- salt to taste
Instructions
1. Wash plantains thoroughly. Trim ends and then cut into 1 inch cylinders. Using a paring knife, make a cut though a raised ridge on the plantain skin. Use your thumb or paring knife to peel.
2. Heat oil in fryer to 325-350 degrees and fry plantains for about 3 minutes. Try not to over crowd, fry in batches if necessary.
3. Remove from fryer, let cool until comfortable to touch. Then, smash plantains with tortilla press to about quarter inch thickness.
4. Sprinkle some salt and return to oil and fry until golden brown and crispy.
5. Transfer unto a paper towel to soak up any excess oil.
6. Serve warm.
Notes

data_info.title: PLANTAIN TAPÉ TAPÉ CAMEROON
data_info.content:
Plantain tapé tapé, also known as tostones, patacones in Latin American and the Carribean is a crispy twice fried green plantain enjoyed in Cameroon. Warm, crispy bites with a pinch of salt enjoyed with your favorite dip or sauce. In Cameroon we enjoy it with a spicy pepper sauce . Simply delightful and you need just a few ingredients to make this.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/tostones-recipe.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
INGREDIENTS FOR PLANTAIN TAPÉ TAPÉ
Green Plantains : They have to be green to be crispy, with a little give once you take a bite. Slightly ripe or ripe plantains will soak up too much oil during the second fry, making them greasy. When buying plantains, make sure they are strong and firm.
Salt : This is all you'll need for seasoning. Add a sprinkle of some kosher salt before the second fry or right after frying.
Oil : These are deep fried, and you'll need to use oils with a high enough smoke point. Canola, soybean and avocado oil all have a smoke point over 400°F. We used canola oil.
PREPARE THE PLANTAINS
You'll find green plantains a little more challenging to peel than ripe plantains. For tapé tapé, plantains are cut into about 1-inch slices before frying. Rather than peeling the entire plantain before cutting, cut before you peel. Thoroughly wash, trim ends and then cut. Then make cuts along ridges until you reach the thick flesh. Use your thumb or paring knife to lift and peel off the skin. You can soak in water to prevent the skin from darkening if you're not frying right away but make sure it is completely dry before frying.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/plantain.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/cut-plantain.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
TO MAKE PLANTAIN TAPÉ TAPÉ
Once your plantains are peeled and cut, you'll start with the first fry. Oil should be at least 350°F. These are big cuts and you 'll fry for about 3 minutes. You want some color change and to partially cook enough to press right after frying. Use a tortilla press to smash the plantains. You can also use a mason jar, a plate, a flat wooden spoon, basically any food safe item that can smash plantains.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/tostones-recipes.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
Sprinkle a pinch of salt on both sides, return the smashed plantain back into the hot oil and fry again until golden brown and crispy. You can also salt right after the second fry. Remove and place on a paper towel to soak up any excess oil.
HOW TO SERVE
This is a great side dish, appetizer or snack. You can simply enjoy as is but here are a few ways we like to enjoy them.
Spicy Pepper Sauce : Some form of spicy sauce is always available at home and we use it as a dip with plantain tapé tapé. You can also serve with a mild sauce or your favorite dip.
Guacamole : Pairing with guac will make a great appetizer for gatherings.
Salsa : Bring in some tropical vibes. Use one to scoop up a hefty dose of mango salsa. Simply refreshing.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/02/Tostones.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
We prefer to enjoy immediately but if you do have some leftovers, it's best reheated in the oven or air fryer. Preheat oven to 350 degrees and reheat for about 5 minutes or until they are crispy, then serve.
Plantain tapé tapé is simply delightful. You'll absolutely savor that first crispy bite but save some for others or at least make enough to share. Grab some green plantains and bring this to the table.
PLANTAIN TAPÉ TAPÉ CAMEROON
Plantain tapé tapé, savory crispy twice fried green plantains enjoyed with a pepper sauce or your favorite dipping sauce
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 10 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 2 large green plantains
- Canola oil for frying
- salt to taste
Instructions
1. Wash plantains thoroughly. Trim ends and then cut into 1 inch cylinders. Using a paring knife, make a cut though a raised ridge on the plantain skin. Use your thumb or paring knife to peel.
2. Heat oil in fryer to 325-350 degrees and fry plantains for about 3 minutes. Try not to over crowd, fry in batches if necessary.
3. Remove from fryer, let cool until comfortable to touch. Then, smash plantains with tortilla press to about quarter inch thickness.
4. Sprinkle some salt and return to oil and fry until golden brown and crispy.
5. Transfer unto a paper towel to soak up any excess oil.
6. Serve warm.
Notes
It is important not to overcrowd, especially during the second fry. When you sprinkle salt before frying the second time, gently pad so it sticks to the plantains. You can also salt after frying but salting before really stays with it.

Text:
REFRESHING SUMMER GARDEN PUNCH
This refreshing summer garden punch is the best thirst-quenching beverage you'll need this summer. The natural sweetness of watermelon and pineapple, the refreshing cooling effects of mint and lemon balm, and the kick of lemon juice and ginger. With this scorching summer heat in full swing, and icy glass of this punch is our picnic favorite!
IGREDIENTS FOR A REFRESHING SUMMER GARDEN PUNCH
We all get excited for summer gardens or produce for a reason, the bounty sure is plentiful. We may not be able to grow all what we want for our punch but we are using some backyard favorites
FRUITS
Watermelon : Watermelon season is in full swing from July through September in Tennessee. I do have some growing the garden but we did buy some for this punch. Watermelon is incredibly hydrating, thanks to its high water content, making it an excellent choice to beat the heat. Its natural sweetness totally eliminates the need for any refined sugars with this punch.
Pineapple : Also adds a natural sweetness with a tropical vibe. It has some anti-inflammatory properties, loaded with vitamin C and antioxidants that contribute to overall health and well-being.
HERBS
Mint : We all love the cooling effect of fresh mint! Mint can help with digestion and may also help alleviate stomach discomfort. Its probably one of the easiest herbs to grow too if you're thinking of a tea garden. Plant this proliferating herb in a container and watch it thrive.
Lemon Balm : Lemon balm is a member of the mint family and adds a subtle lemony flavor to the punch. If you love mint tea, you'll love lemon balm tea even better! So if you're not familiar with this amazing herb yet, give it a try. It is known for its calming effects and may help reduce stress and anxiety. Lemon balm also contains antioxidants and is believed to have antiviral properties.
SPICES & MORE
Ginger : Brings in some kick and spice. Ginger is well known for its digestive benefits and may help reduce nausea and inflammation. Here's a refreshing wellness drink we make with ginger. It complements the sweetness of the pineapple and watermelon.
Lemon Juice: The tangy zest of lemon juice adds a burst of acidity to our garden punch. Lemons are a great source of vitamin C and antioxidants offering an immune boost.
Bring a pitcher of this refreshing summer garden punch to your next picnic, backyard barbecue or any summer gathering. It is hydrating, thirst quenching and will definitely please the crowd. You can also use is as base for an enjoyable cocktail with the addition of your favorite spirit.
REFRESHING SUMMER GARDEN PUNCH
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 5 cups of Watermelon cubes (( about 1 pound))
- 1 and 1/2 cups Pineapple cubes
- 1 and 1/2 cups cubed cucumbers
- 1/2 inch cube chunk of ginger
- 10 mint leaves
- 10 lemon balm leaves
- 1/4 cup lemon juice
Instructions
1. Combine all ingredients into a blender except lemon juice. Blend until smooth.
2. Place cheesecloth into a good-sized bowl. Transfer blended ingredients into cheesecloth and squeeze out as much juice as you can. Discard pulp
3. Add in lemon juice, stir and serve over ice or chill for at least 30 minutes until ready to serve.
4. Consume within 3 days.

Text:
refreshing sorrel drink
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/sorrell-tea.jpg?fit=1280%2C1829&ssl=1]
Refreshing sorrel drink.Your ultimate summer thirst quenching favorite on ice. Also your warm "mug in hand" by the fireplace tea for any cold winter night.
Got a kids party to plan? A pitcher of this refreshing sorrel drink is your go to. Spike it up with your favorite liqueur for the adults. Do label please!
Point is you can serve this up anytime, regardless of the season. There are no limits. Your guests will definitely be pleased.
[image: https://i1.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/sorrell-drink.jpg?fit=1280%2C1920&ssl=1]
REFRESHING SORREL DRINK TIPS
[image: https://i2.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/09/IMG_3248.jpg?fit=1920%2C1280&ssl=1]
You can find the dried hibiscus tea at your local Caribbean/Mexican grocery store. I get mine from a Mexican grocery store. You can also purchase online. Nowadays there is an online market for everything.
You'll also need one large pineapple. Preferably organic or thoroughly washed as you will be using the skin. This recipe is very similar to my folere recipe but with some extra additions. Love them both. You want to steep for at least six hours. I actually do an overnight batch typically and strain in the morning.
To get a little more of the pineapple flavor, crush about half of the pineapple and add together with the peel. The boil should help with pasteurization. So it is not a surprise this can last more than a week in the refrigerator. It never does though......its that good.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/sorrell-hibiscus-tea.jpg?fit=1280%2C1920&ssl=1]
Warm notes of cinnamon , cloves and star Anise. A little tropical vibe from the pineapple. You can sweeten or completely skip the added sugar. The dried sorrel also impacts a little tartness. Get a little more kick by adding some fresh ginger.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/11/sorrell-ice-drink.jpg?fit=1280%2C1920&ssl=1]
With the holidays coming up, we will definitely be serving this at some point. Join the party and enjoy a pitcher of this refreshing sorrel drink on us. Go grab your ingredients and don't forget to share your creations with us.
REFRESHING SORRELL DRINK
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 15 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 4 Quarts of water
- 4 cups dried hibiscus tes (sorrel)
- 1 large pineapple
- 10 cloves
- 4 star Anise
- 1 medium cinammon stick
Instructions
1. Thoroughly wash pineapple. Peel and transfer into a large pot. Crush half of the pineapple and add into pot.
2. Add 4 quarts of water and bring to a rapid boil. Add in dried hibiscus tea, cloves anise and cinnamon. Boil for an 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let sit for 6- 8 hours.
3. Strain with a colander to remove pineapple skin and big chunks, Use a small mesh sieve and strain two more times. To sweeten, prepare simple syrup by mixing 1 cup of sugar with 1 cup of water. Let dissolve over low to medium heat. Use to sweeten tea to taste.
4. Best served after refrigeration or on ice. Can also be enjoyed warm.

Text:
Red Lentil Curry Soup
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/Curry-Red-Lentil-soup..jpg?resize=1280%2C1920&ssl=1]
Red Lentil Curry Soup
Ten minutes after walking into the kitchen , I told my husband to keep an eye on this slow simmering skillet of red lentil curry soup.
Today we are cooking with red lentils! I have shared my kitchen cabinet project with y'all it sure has been helpful. Do check it out here. Seeing each jar opens a new realm of new kitchen ideas on meals. Like this flavorful bowl of curry lentil soup.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/06/Kitchen-pantry-project.jpg?resize=1280%2C1920&ssl=1]
Red Lentils cook super quick, so this is definitely what you want if you want to spend as little time as you want in the kitchen. This weather definitely calls for a warm bowl of soup. We are keeping it light but feel free to add cup of diced Idaho potatoes to give it a little more body. Green lentils will work just fine , but it will take a little longer to cook.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/Curry-Lentil-Soup.jpg?resize=1280%2C1920&ssl=1]
This soup is strictly vegan, low calorie and the perfect cleanse after the holidays. Lord knows I had one too many treats this season. If your new years resolution involves eating a little better, I hope you add this to your weekly meal plan.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/Curry-Red-Lentil-Soup.jpg?resize=1171%2C1756&ssl=1]
CURRY LENTIL SOUP
Ingredients
- 1 and 1/2 cup red lentils (rinsed)
- 3/4 cup chopped onions
- 1 Tbsp minced garlic
- 1 tsp cumin
- 1 tsp coriander
- 1 tsp curry powder
- 1/2 tsp paprika
- 1 tsp tumeric
- 4-6 cups of water
- 1 Tbsp canola oil
Instructions
1. Heat large skillet on medium heat. Add oil and chopped onions. Saute for about 2-3 minutes until they become translucent. Add in garlic, stir and cook for just under a minute.
2. Add all spices except for anise and cloves. Reduce heat and continue to stir for another minute or so. Add lentils with 4 cups of water. Simmer on medium to low heat for about 25 minutes until lentils are cooked. Add more water if you want a lighter soup.
3. Broil Anise and cloves in the oven until they just start to smoke. Add into soup. Season with salt, stir and cook for another 3-5 minutes. Enjoy

Text:
Rice and Black beans Skillet
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/Rice-and-beans-recipes.jpg?resize=1139%2C1709&ssl=1]
Rice and Black Beans
This rice and black beans dish is simple, flavorful and ready in as little as 20 minutes. If you are like me and always have cooked beans in the freezer and sometimes left over cooked rice, dinner will always be a breeze. There is always premeasure frozen beans in the freezer, ALWAYS. You can definitely use canned beans but it is much more affordable and better to cook your own. You control the salt and I honestly think it taste a lot better than canned beans.
Canned beans will work just fine with this recipe, I recommend you get them with a little salt.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/Rice-and-Black-beans.jpg?resize=1250%2C1858&ssl=1]
This is really the meal for a busy mom or dad, or career woman who enjoys some good home cooking , but doesn't want to spend too much time in the kitchen. The perfect meal prep option for that gym fanatic. Complete protein in one plate. I'm saying no to food waste here. Use that left over rice. Here I'm using basmati rice but you can definitely use brown rice.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/Rice-and-beans.jpg?resize=1280%2C1920&ssl=1]
Dishes like this should make everyone want to cook something at home . Even that person who never cooks will be drawn by the ease and how quick this dish comes together.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/Rice-and-Beans-recipe.jpg?resize=1180%2C1771&ssl=1]
Cooking doesn't have to be complicated. Keep it simple, delicious and hearty. Like this rice and black beans skillet. Share, rate and tag me on Instagram if you recreate any of my recipes. I love hearing how and whether you enjoy it as much as my we do.
RICE AND BLACK BEANS SKILLET
One pot easy skillet rice and beans. Ready in under 30 minutes, satifying, hearty and stickly vegan
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 20 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 3 cups pre cooked black beans ((salted))
- 1 cup cooked long grained basmati rice..salted ((Can substitute for brown rice))
- 1 Shallot Minced ((About 1/2 cup))
- 1 Tbsp crushed garlic
- 1/2 Tbsp crushed ginger
- 1/2 cup chopped spring onions
- 2 Tbsp canola oil
- 1 tsp white pepper
- salt to taste
- 1 Cup Whole cherry tomatoes
Instructions
1. Heat oil over medium heat in a skillet. Add in shallots and cherry tomatoes. Sautee until shallots just start to brown. Some of the tomatoes will pop open at this point. About 3-5 minutes
2. Add in cooked black beans, garlic and ginger, stir well and cook for about 7-10 minutes. Add a little water if getting too dry. Season to taste with salt and white pepper.
3. Finally add cooked rice and chopped scallions. Mix well and cook for about 5 more minutes. Adjust seasoning if necessary. Enjoy

Text:
Salmon Shrimp taco boat
These salmon shrimp taco boats were such a fun idea stemming from never having hard shell tacos at home. Actually, I never buy them at all.. For reasons I can't even tell you. I always go for soft shelled, maybe because they are a little easier to handle. Or maybe because I hate looking like a messy eater in public, crumbs all over the place.
This blessed day I wanted that crunch! And in the absence of hard shell tacos a new idea was born, taco boats. I've sliced and baked tortillas before to use as topping for soups. This was pretty much the same concept. You can make bowls or boats. The idea of boats obviously sounds more fun to me. You can make them whatever shape you want, it's so fun. Your mold determines the shape you get. It should be an oven safe dish. Some whole wheat flour tortillas were use. Brush with olive oil, sprinkle a pinch of salt and black pepper. Place in you mold, push around the corners so it takes the shape of your mold. Don't worry about the folds, it add to the eye appeal. Bake at a 350 preheated oven until it shapes up. There! You got yourself a homemade taco boat! or bowl, or cup.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/salmon-taco-bowls.jpg?resize=1280%2C1280&ssl=1]
Now this is where you let loose with fillings and toppings. A fun filled and delectable salmon shrimp taco boat topped with a mango chili salsa and lettuce. Mangoes are probably my favorite fruit followed by pineapples. So this simple salsa definitely holds a special quadrant in my heart.... for real! Makes me think of the tropics and my tree climbing days. I'm too scared of heights now to even attempt anything that crazy. Funny how you think you're untouchable when you're a child but as an adult you worry about breaking bones. I still remember my uncle's warnings on the dangers of my little adventures in the orchard as a child. Lets just say he won't even have to warn me today
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/salsa.jpg?resize=1176%2C1176&ssl=1]
We love our seafood in this household. If scallops were not such a wallet drain, they probably would've made it on this taco boat. The 18 year balsamic used to marinade the salmon and shrimp was a gift from my mother in law. The dark, rich and sweet notes from the balsamic really complemented the proteins. Sweet and Spicy!
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/taco-bowls.jpg?resize=1060%2C1186&ssl=1]
We dug in and I didn't care about the crumbs. Sweet, spicy and packed with wonderful flavors with each bite. Hope you get to try this salmon shrimp taco boat. Its hearty, flavorful and delicious.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/tacos-bowls-with-salmon-and-shrimp.jpg?resize=1186%2C1186&ssl=1]
SALMON SHRIMP TACO BOAT
Spicy shrimp taco boats with a mango chili salsa.
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 15 minutes mins
Ingredients
Shrimp
- 12 jumbo shrimps (peeled and deveined)
- 1 Tbsp 18 year balsamic
- 1/2 Tbsp Persian lime olive oil
- pinch of salt/black pepper
Salmon
- 3 salmon fillets (( about an inch thick))
- 1 Tbsp packed miced cilantro
- 1/2 Tbsp Persian lime olive oil ((or any olive oil))
- 1 Tbsp 18 year balsamic
- pinch Kosher Salt/Black Pepper/red pepper flakes
Mango Chili Salsa
- 1 cup mango diced
- 1 cup Roma Tomatoes diced
- 1/4 cup chopped green chili
- 1 Tbsp chopped red onions
- 1/4 cup Chopped Cilantro
- juice from one lime
Taco boats
- 4-6 whole wheat flour tortillas
- 2-3 cups chopped lettuce
Instructions
1. Rinse shrimp and salmon. Pad dry with kitchen/ paper towel. In separate bowls marinade with listed ingredients for about 20 minutes.
2. Meanwhile in a bowl, combine all ingredients for salsa, mix well and season according to taste.
3. Preheat oven to 350. With a pastry brush, rub tortillas with with olive oil. Sprinkle some salt and black pepper .Place in a boat shaped bowl (your mold) and press towards the corners. Bake until its crunchy and takes the shape of your bowl.( About 7 minutes)
4. Preheat a large cast iron skillet (moderate heat ). Drizzle some olive and grill salmon on each side for about 5 minutes until completely cooked. Grill shrimp on each side for about 3 minutes until cooked.
5. Build your taco boats to your liking. I started with chopped lettuce, salsa, shrimp, salmon and more salsa. Add a squeeze of lime juice and enjoy
Notes
Any sweet dark balsamic should work. Same with olive oil.

Text:
Roasted Butternut Squash and kale salad w/ couscous
Fall and winter salads never get old in this household. This roasted butternut squash is my treasured squash of choice to integrate in warm salads. This boldly colored beauty is low in fat, fiber packed , loaded with carotenoids and other essential vitamins/minerals. Save the seeds, they make one scrumptious snack! Drizzle a little olive oil, dash of salt and pepper, in the oven and you're good to go. Satisfy that random midday cravings.
The butternut squash is also exceptionally easy to cook. Feel free to peel or just slice down the middle, take out the seeds and cook as desired. I almost always oven roast them. It is very fleshy and provides the well needed substance in hearty soups, like this pinto beans and butternut squash soup ,salads, desserts, purees and more.
There are so many other squashes that you can use. Any winter squash will work and you can also easily substitute with sweet potatoes. Want to substitute Kale? Go with greens that maintain a little bit of their structure when cooked like collards or turnip greens. Spinach wilts a little too much for this recipe but you are welcome to use it.
This dish definitely left a sweet note on my taste buds. The roasted butternut squash also complements the robustness of the kale wonderfully.
ROASTED BUTTERNUT SQUASH AND KALE SALAD
Warm fall / winter salad with oven roasted tamarind flavored butternut squash, baby kale and couscous
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 30 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 1 medium butternut squash (washed peeled and diced into ~1/2 inch cubes ( 3 cups))
- 2-4 sage leaves
- 2/3 cups semolina couscous (cooked according to package direction)
- 1/4 cup sliced onions
- 1 bunch of kale ((wash and roughly chop))
- 2 Tbsp Essiespice Tamarind Oh ((Or any sweet tamarind sauce))
- 2 tsp pineapple balsamic ((or lemon juice))
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 Tbsp smart balance olive oil spread ((Or any high heat cooking oil))
Instructions
1. Preheat oven to 400
2. In a large fry pan melt olive oil spread, add sage leaves, stir and cook for about 1 minute. Turn heat off. Add squash and TamarindOh sauce. Mix well. Transfer to a baking sheet and bake at for 30 minutes or until tender
3. Then, heat oil in a large fry pan and sauté onions for 1-2 minutes. Add chopped kale, 1- 2 Tablespoons of water, cover and cook for about 3 minutes (most of the water should've evaporated) until just tender . Add balsamic and stir.
4. Combine with couscous and finally add oven roasted squash , stir gently.Season to taste and enjoy

Text:
Savory Potato Hash with Egg whites
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Potato-hash-with-egg-whites.jpg?resize=1377%2C1280&ssl=1]
Anyone up to try this simple savory potato hash?
First off , I love Potatoes!!! One of my most treasured starches. Breakfast, lunch, supper, it has a place on the menu. So I told myself, Eggs and savory potato hash browns for breakfast today....... does it get any better?
Crispy with a soft center for the perfect bite.
Simply seasoned with kosher salt, black pepper and my must use, fresh garlic, onions and parsley. Drizzled some rosemary olive oil, gave it a quick toss, into the oven and out comes a steaming tray of the best hash I have ever made.
I achieved my perfect crisp by giving the potato chunks a little microwave time before baking. Dicing into small cubes definitely helped them cook in little to no time. The rest will probably be the easiest potato hash you've ever made
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Snapseed.jpg?resize=1377%2C1280&ssl=1]
Thinking about inviting a few friends over for brunch? A crowd pleasing batch can be made with just a little prep. You can par cook the potatoes the night before and season with salt and pepper . Morning of just involves your fresh garlic, onions, parsley and a few minutes in the oven.
Brunch at home just got better!!
SAVORY POTATO HASH AND EGGS
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 20 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 2 medium Idaho Potatoes (washed and cubbed- skin on ( About 3 cups))
- 1 Tbsp minced garlic
- 1/2 small onion (sliced)
- 1/4 cup Parsley (chopped)
- 1 Tbsp rosemary infused (olive oil)
- pinch of salt
- pinch of black pepper
Instructions
1. Wash and dice potatoes into small cubes. Transfer to a large microwave safe tray lined with some paper towels. (Single Layer) Cook for 5 minutes.
2. Remove, transfer to a large bowl, add olive oil and toss. Add all remaining ingredients except parsley. Mix well and bake at 375 for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown and crispy.
3. Garnish with parsley and serve with eggs any style

Text:
Seafood Curry with crookneck squash
Heart warming bowl of seafood curry with salmon, shrimp and some crookneck squash from this summers' harvest. The crookneck squash is quite similar to the butternut squash but just a tart sweeter. Especially if it's a fresh harvest. In all honesty we had so much squash this year, I heard a few " Please not squash again!" mumbles. So we took a break from it for about a month and this bowl right here is the best way to start off again with squash.
We are using salmon and shrimp for the seafood but you are welcome to substitute or add on. A great option if your are on a plant based diet will be tofu. This pinto beans and butternut squash soup is a great vegan option.
SEAFOOD CURRY MARINADE
We marinated the shrimp and salmon together as it really is unnecessary to do so separately. Essiespice coco for garlic goes a long way but if you can also use some salt, black pepper and garlic. Something simple just to build up some flavor with the seafood. 15 to 20 minutes is long enough without any citrus ( like lime or lemon).
TIPS / COOKING THE SEAFOOD
Shrimp cooks in not time and gets quite chewy if overcooked. So it is important to sear for just about a minute on each side. Sear salmon for about a couple of minutes on each side too. When returning seafood into skillet , add salmon about 3 minutes before shrimp goes in. Avoid breaking salmon by gently shaking skillet to stir or use a wooden spoon to gently stir.
Despite our overabundance and almost boredom with squash , this is the comeback we all needed. This bowl will definitely not be taking a break. Its simple, made with ingredients you probably already have around. Hope you get to enjoy a bowl soon. Don't forget to share with us what you've been cooking from the afrovitalityeats kitchen.
SEAFOOD CURRY WITH CROOKNECK SQASH
Prep Time: 15 minutes mins, Cook Time: 50 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 1/2 lb raw tail on shrimp de-veined
- 2 salmon fillets halved
- 2 Tbsp ESSIESPICE Coco-for-garlic ((or any garlic forward marinade of choice))
- 2 Tbsp avocado oil
- 1/2 cup packed diced onions
- 2 and 1/2 cups crookneck squash diced
- 1 & 1/2 Tbsp thai red curry paste
- 4 garlic cloves grated ((about 1 heaping tablespoon))
- 1/2 Tbsp crushed ginger
- 1 small roma tomatoes diced ((about 1/2 cup))
- 1 tsp fish sauce
- salt & black pepper to taste
- 3 cups of water ((or more for thinner soup))
- 12 ounces coconut milk
- 1/2-1/4 cup chopped cilantro (for garnish)
- 1 lime halved
Instructions
1. Marinade shrimp and salmon in a bowl with coco for garlic for about 20-30 minutes
2. Heat large skillet and add avocado oil. Then pan sear salmon for about 2 minutes on each side. Remove and set aside. Cook shrimp for about a minute on each side and set aside too
3. In the same skillet add a little more avocado oil and saute onions for about 3-5 minutes or until translucent. Add in curry paste, garlic , tomatoes and diced squash and cook for another 3-5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4. Add 2 cups of water, season with salt and black pepper, let simmer for about 15-20 minutes is just tender. Add coconut milk, crushed ginger, cover and for about 10 minutes. Add more water or broth for a lighter soup. Season to taste
5. Return salmon to skillet. After simmering for about 2-3 minutes, add shrimp and gently stir. Cook for a couple of minutes and remove from heat.
6. Garnish with chopped cilantro and lime. Serve with rice.

Text:
Savory Potato Hash and Eggs
You could make breakfast as simple and as quick as you want. In fact I fancy those gourmet 4 course breakfast meals served at quaint little bed and breakfast, but lets be honest who does that everyday? Be it a 4 course meal or a simple toast in the morning , the key is " do not be boring!". Most people skip breakfast ( That's just criminal), not me. Breakfast is viewed just like your avid coffee consumer by me, I get cranky without it. My 9-5 needs me to be pleasant, so I'll definitely set that alarm 30 minutes early for this quick and easy potato hash. Oh! but you can do better. You can sleep another 10 minutes if you chop everything up the night before.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/www.afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Savory-Loaded-Hash-and-Eggs-1024x1024.jpg?resize=900%2C900]
SAVORY POTATO HASH AND EGGS
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 25 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 2 medium Idaho Potatoes (diced into small cubes (wash throroughly))
- 1/4 Cup diced red Onions
- 1/2 Cup diced sweet peppers
- 1/3 Cup Chopped Kale
- 1 Tbsp minced garlic
- 1 Tbsp Rosemary Olive oil
- a pinch Kosher Salt/Black Pepper
- 4 whole eggs
- Chopped Cilantro (for garnish)
Instructions
1. Preheat Oven to 400. .
2. Combine all ingredients in a bowl (except eggs) and toss to mix. Heat skillet over medium heat and generously grease with olive oil spray. Add in potato mixture, and saute for about 3 minutes.
3. Transfer to oven and bake for about 15 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
4. Add in eggs and bake for another 5 to 7 minutes until egg whites are cooked and runny. Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve.

[image: https://i0.wp.com/www.afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/Savory-Loaded-Hash-and-Eggs-1024x1024.jpg?resize=900%2C900]

Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 25 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 2 medium Idaho Potatoes (diced into small cubes (wash throroughly))
- 1/4 Cup diced red Onions
- 1/2 Cup diced sweet peppers
- 1/3 Cup Chopped Kale
- 1 Tbsp minced garlic
- 1 Tbsp Rosemary Olive oil
- a pinch Kosher Salt/Black Pepper
- 4 whole eggs
- Chopped Cilantro (for garnish)
Instructions
1. Preheat Oven to 400. .

Text:
Shrimp plantain tacos with a mango salsa
Plantain tacos
Shrimp plantain tacos. At this point I ask my self, is there anything you can't achieve with plantains. So versatile. Your search for plantain recipes here and around the web yields numerous results from chips, to desserts, main courses and so much more. You create your own boundaries when it comes to plantains, for there are essentially none. We've enjoyed soups like this Black beans and plantain stew . A delightful, colorful plantain bowl like this Tropical Plantain Breakfast Bowl . Bake it to a crunch like this delicious must try Baked Semi Sweet Plantain chips . And lets not forget, the best way to enjoy plantains. Live and let live with this fried Sweet plantain and black bean bowl
You see, even though plantain is popular in African, Caribbean and Spanish cuisine, I consider it a global ingredient. Let it take the lead. Like I did with these spicy shrimp plantain tacos. We all know how simple or complex we can make tacos. I have absolutely no restrain when it comes to taco toppings. I'll walk down that taco bar like its the last thing I have to eat in my lifetime. I can't help it.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/IMG_2723.jpg?resize=1280%2C1280&ssl=1]
These plantain tacos are simply the best. The ripe plantains add some well needed body, making these deliciously satisfying. The sweet and lightly tangy mango chunks pairs wonderfully. Giving the tacos a tropical feel. I absolutely love purple cabbage! It adds a nice crunch and beautiful color. It easily invites you to dig in and take a huge bite. Bring on the Mai tai, Margaritas and other fruity patootie drinks to wash these down. Long gone vacations are relived through plates like these.
Give those corn tortillas a little char and get to building these simple, hearty and ultra delicious shrimp plantain tacos. Thank me later, and I'll love you too if you make these for me everyday.
SHRIMP PLANTAIN TACOS WITH
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 30 minutes mins
Ingredients
Shrimp marinade
- 1/2 bunch Parsley ((about 6 sprigs))
- 3 garlic cloves
- a chunk of ginger ((about 1/2 inch cube))
- 1 small-medium Scotch bonnet pepper ((or harbanero))
- 1 Tbsp olive oil
- 1-2 pinches of kosher salt
Mango Salsa
- 1 cup diced mangoes
- 1/3 cup Chopped Cilantro
- 1 cup diced roma tomatoes
- juice of 1 lime
Dressing
- a squeeze of lemon juice (half a lemon)
- 1 Tbsp olive oil
Shrimp Plantain tacos
- 2 ripe plantains
- 1 Tbsp olive oil
- 1/2 pound jumbo shrimp
- 1 cup sliced purple cabbage
Instructions
1. Preheat oven to 400. Wash peel and slice plantains into small cubes and transfer into a bowl. Drizzle about a tablespoon of olive oil. Toss to mix and transfer into a greased baking sheet. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until they start to turn brown. Set aside.
2. Using a hand blender or small food processor, combine all ingredients for shrimp marinade and roughly blend (pulse). Mixture should be chunky. Rinse shrimp, pad dry and transfer into a bowl. Add in 2/3 of the marinade, mix well, seal with saran wrap and refrigerate for about 15 minutes
3. Meanwhile to prepare salsa, simply combine all ingredients in a bowl. Mix well and adjust for seasoning. Using remaining 3rd of the shrimp marinade add in lemon juice and olive oil. season to taste with salt and black pepper. Set aside. Quickly grill tortillas on open flame for about 15-20 second on each side until slightly charred.
4. Preheat cast iron skillet. Drizzle some olive oil and grill shrimp for about 3 minutes on each side. Transfer to a serving platter and build tacos as desired. Here I started with the baked plantains, then added the mango salsa, shrimp, purple cabbage and topped with the dressing and a squeeze of lime juice for good measure. Enjoy

Text:
Simple Baguette Egg Sandwich
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/06/Cameroon-breakfast-baguette-egg-sandwich.jpg?resize=600%2C1260&ssl=1]
This simple breakfast baguette egg sandwich takes me way back to my secondary school days.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Breakfast-Egg-Sandwich.jpg?resize=1499%2C1137&ssl=1]
Waking up so early and trying to catch the bus to school, breakfast didn't usually come until we got to school just before class. Right next to class was this tiny little hut, single handedly manned by the most amazing egg sandwich maker I knew at that time. There was always a line, and I can't even imagine how she got to serve all those hungry students before class. Now I wonder if she baked the bread in house but all I know is the moment my 150 CFA francs ( ~$0.25) was collected every morning, I was ready for a delicious warm baguette filled with the perfect omelet. Simply made with tomatoes and onions and seasoned to perfection.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Eggs.jpg?resize=1272%2C1272&ssl=1]
I'll chow down that sandwich in little to no time and wish I could have more! That was it though, had to save my remaining cash for lunch.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Scrambled-eggs.jpg?resize=1280%2C1280&ssl=1]
Anyways, like I said, this recipe is super simple and it really did brightened my morning. Freshly baked baguette is definitely a must , hence my early morning trip to our local bakery in town. Even better if you bake your own bread . Everything else should be in your kitchen.
Not that coffee was on the menu back then but feel free to enjoy this one with a cup of joe or tea. Breakfast doesn't get any better than this. Believe me when I say you'll enjoy every hearty bite of this sandwich .
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/03/Simple-Bread-and-egg-sandwich.jpg?resize=1654%2C1280&ssl=1]
Hope you get to try this sandwich. And if you're brainstorming on quick office breakfast ideas, I'm sure your colleagues will have lots to say about this baguette egg sandwich. Grab a few extra baguettes and impress the team. While at it, don't hold me responsible when they keep requesting you bring breakfast.
SIMPLE BAGUETTE EGG SANDWICH
Prep Time: 5 minutes mins, Cook Time: 10 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 1 foot long french baguette
- 6 whole eggs
- 1 roma tomatoes (diced)
- 1/4 cup Yellow Onions (thinly sliced)
- 1/4 cup chopped parsley
- 1/2 Tbsp olive oil
- salt to taste
Instructions
1. Whisk eggs with onions and tomatoes, season with a pinch of salt
2. Heat oil in a medium skillet and add eggs. Do no scramble.
3. Cook until set enough to flip (~3 minutes). Flip and cook for another couple of minutes or so.
4. Slice baguette down the middle and fill the pocket with cooked eggs. Garnish with chopped fresh parsley and serve

Text:
Simple Seafood Medley Stew
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2015/10/watermark635819041834919632.png?w=660&resize=660%2C495]
Rainy Halloween days call for a hearty , warm flavorsome stew in this household. Let's just say mother nature is not smiling down on the " trick-or-treaters" here. No baked treats or candy this year; but our wonderful neighbor has a huge plastic pumpkin filled with all the delightful sweet treats we crave. For now, we're being good and spending Halloween with a huge bowl of stew and a marathon of scary movies.
Here, is a simple stew that should please most if not All!!!
INGREDIENTS
- 1 medium red onion chopped
- 3 celery stalk chopped
- 3 medium Roma tomatoes diced
- 1 14.5 oz can hunts diced tomatoes (Unsalted)
- 5 cloves garlic minced
- 1 cup vegetable broth
- 1 lb bag frozen seafood medley (Thaw in cold water and drain)
- ~ 2 Tbsp olive oil
INSTRUCTIONS
- Heat oil in skillet. When hot add onions and cook for ~ 2 minutes. Then add in garlic , celery and cook for ~ 5 minutes.
- Add in diced Roma tomatoes , stir and cook for another 5 minutes.
- Stir in seafood medley, cover and cook for about 10 minutes on medium heat.
- Lastly add canned tomatoes, vegetable broth, cover and simmer for 25-30 minutes. Then season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with rice or some freshly baked bread.
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2015/10/watermark635819007255245311.png?w=660&resize=660%2C495]
Notes
I enjoy left overs but when it comes to seafood, I'd rather not run the risk. If you made extra and want to save some for left overs please store at an appropriate temperature and for no more than 2 days. Food poisoning is real and very unpleasant, be safe.
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2015/10/watermark635819041243714595.png?w=660&resize=660%2C495]

Text:
SIMPLE CROISSANT EGG SANDWICH
This simple croissant egg sandwich is one of the easiest and well-loved breakfast items you can add to your breakfast or brunch menu. In just about 20 minutes your family and guests will be biting into this flaky goodness stuffed with delicious eggs. Picture a Parisian Cafe right in your own home. Just in time for Easter!
Disclosure: I will be compensated if you make a purchase through the referral link. Opinions are strictly my own
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/Croissant-sandwich.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
CAN WE MAKE AHEAD?
Now if you're hosting any gathering, the food needs to be on point but we don't need to labor for hours. You need to enjoy your party just as much as your guests if not more. That being said, it takes over 13 hours to make croissants from scratch. You do not have to do that, these wildgrain croissants come frozen and bakes in no time. You can bake the croissants ahead of time and give them a quick warm just before serving.
MAKING THE EGGS
BUILDING YOUR SIMPLE CROISSANT SANDWICH
These eggs are just simply delicious. That is definitely what we love about this meal at home. Make it as is, again we want to enjoy our party as much as our guests or you can build from here. When the pastry you are working with is amazing, there is no need to doctor things up too much. That being said, here are a few things you can add to your sandwich.
Dressing : We are using some real mayonnaise as a spread, but you can also use cream cheese, butter or other spreads of choice.
Greens : Arugula, Spinach, butter lettuce you name it. Try to use something light that adds to but will not overpower other flavors. I love kale, but we will have to hold off on the kale here but if you're so inclined, you're welcome to add some. Go for tender, baby kale leaves
Meats and fish : Bacon, sausage, prosciutto, smoked salmon. Bringing up the protein content to make it an even more substantial meal.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/12/croissant.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
Make your next brunch gathering special and effortless with these simple croissant egg sandwich. Serve alongside some cut fruits and your favorite beverage. You can always make our hibiscus tea ahead of time to bring everything together. Enjoy and feel free to find out about wildgrain on this link .
SIMPLE CROISSANT EGG SANDWICH
This Simple croissant egg sandwich is one of the easiest and well-loved breakfast items you can add to your Easter brunch menu.
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 10 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 5 large eggs
- 1/2 cup diced Roma tomatoes
- 1/8 cup thinly sliced onion
- 1/8 cup chopped parsley
- 1/4 tsp Black pepper
- 1/2 tsp salt (( Or to taste))
- 1 Tbsp Avocado oil ( or butter)
- 4 croissants
- mayonnaise
Instructions
1. Crack eggs into a bowl, add diced tomatoes, onions, parsley , salt, black pepper and whisk together until frothy.
2. On a heated nonstick skillet, add avocado oil. Then pour whisked eggs to skillet. Spread to ensure tomatoes , onions and parsley are evenly spread out.
3. As egg cooks, lift from sides and tilt pan so uncooked portion flows and cooks (about 3-4 minutes)
4. Then flip and cook another minute or until egg whites are set and not runny. Don't be afraid to break it apart. Transfer to a plate
5. To build sandwich, quickly toast croissant in the oven for about 2 minutes if not freshly baked. Then slice croissant open and spread mayonnaise on one or both sides. Fill croissant with eggs, close sandwich and they are ready to serve
6. Enjoy!
Notes
Transfer eggs from skillet to plate when ready to avoid overcooking your eggs. You can use other preferred condiments as spreads.

Text:
Simple Shrimp Suya Salad w/ Serano honey vinaigrette
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2016/04/image9.jpeg?resize=585%2C592]
Mekko Dry Rub
Suya is a popular street food in Cameroon and other west African countries. It's usually beef, chicken , shrimp or other meats well seasoned with spices and fire grilled. Next to a bar, is usually a suya stand. That's a good and ideal business strategy for local suya vendors. With drinks flowing, so does traffic to the suya stand. It has that perfect heat to clear that unwanted hangover.
People debate their first meals when they visit home. As for me, there's nothing to think about. Hopefully my favorite suya vendor is still in business, because that's my first stop from the airport the moment I arrive Cameroon.
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2016/04/image8.jpeg?resize=598%2C598]
Used Essiespice Mekko Dry Rub for the shrimp skewers.What makes this spice work so well is obviously the ground peanuts. It's versatility works wonderfully to enhance the flavors of the shrimp and the salad as a whole.
Simple is good.
Simple is delicious.
Simple is what I crave....... simple is what the average person craves.
[image: https://ourquickbytes.files.wordpress.com/2016/04/image7.jpeg?resize=613%2C613]

Text:
Spicy Avocado Toast and Egg
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/Avocado-Toast-spicy.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
Spicy Avocado Toast. Most mornings, there is a steaming bowl of oatmeal ready to go before my tribe awakes. Other mornings prayers to the toddler gods and hopes for an extra 30 minutes of sleep are unheeded. As I drag myself out of bed I regret the late night. You'd think at this point I should've learned to close the paper back by 9pm. Not a chance , and I suppose no such luck with them sleeping in this weekend either.
I suppose we are rising and embracing the day with this spicy avocado toast topped with some crispy edged sunny side up eggs.
EGGS AND AVOCADO
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/eggs-.jpg?resize=682%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/05/Avocado.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
How is your egg situation? Most mornings we do hear that "cock-a-doodle-doo" coming from our neighbor's backyard. Country living...sorta. who would've thought! Next to summer long vegetable baskets from the neighbors, their farm fresh eggs are unbeatable.
PICK THE RIGHT AVOCADO
The convenient clicklist. How about those avocados? My note section on my clicklist order usually reads "only 2 ready to eat, and 4 firm please". Hah! Like that ever works. Pick up order and yeahhhhh, they're finally rid of the two that were going to the trash. Solution to this, go grab your avocados, or keep it off the clicklist. Firm avocados will ripen in 3-4 days, give or take, so plan accordingly. To pick ready to eat one, grab the whole avocado and gently press with the thump. You should feel a little give but not so much that there is a dent. Also, if there is a little stalk left, tug that off. It should be green and not brown. This should help but again, there has still been some disappointments despite all the efforts.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/IMG_0001.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/IMG_0004.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/IMG_0007.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/IMG_0001_1.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/IMG_0004_1.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/IMG_0006_1-3.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
Can we dive into this quick avocado toast? Revamping my mother's "pear and bread" breakfast. Avocado is pear in Cameroon. They are buttery and gigantic compared to hass avocados. . Some red onions for the needed crunch; a little maple syrup for some sweetness and a touch of heat with the mango chili medley from Essiespice . Go as spicy as you'd like, we love it spicy here.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/IMG_0001_2.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
If your lot is as hungry as mine ever morning, this plate will come to your rescue. It's simple, quick, healthy and hearty. Mornings are a lot easier to manage when food is ready in a pinch. If you've got 10 minutes, here is your breakfast, lunch or even dinner for the day.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2021/01/Avo-toast-spicy.jpg?resize=683%2C1024&ssl=1]
We hope you enjoy it , and do share what else from the afrovitalityeats' kitchen you've been making.
SPICY AVOCADO TOAST AND EGG
Prep Time: 5 minutes mins, Cook Time: 5 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 1 Large Avocado
- 1 Tbsp distilled vinegar
- 1 Tbsp Vegenaise ((sub with mayonnaise))
- 1 tsp maple syrup
- 1 tsp Essiespice Mango Chili Medley (( or more ))
- 2 slices of bread.
- 1 Tbsp chopped red onion
- a sprinkle or red pepper flakes
- cilantro for garnish
Instructions
1. In a bowl combine , vegenaise, distilled vinegar, maple syrup and the mango chili medley. Stir well until homogeneous. Peel and cut avocado into small chunks. Transfer into bowl and mix gently ensuring it's not mushy. Set aside.
2. Heat about a table spoon of oil in a large non stick pan. Carefully crack eggs , ensuring yolk stays intact. Cook until white is set and edges are just brown and crispy.
3. Toast bread in toaster or grill. Spread mango chili medley on toast (optional for more heat). Add scoops of avocado mix and spread. Top with fried egg. Season eggs with some salt and a dash of red pepper flakes.
4. Garnish with fresh cilantro and enjoy

Text:
Spicy Black bean salad bowl
Spicy black bean salad bowl, a heart warming comfort food for all. Loaded with lots of fresh spices, peppers and the most delicious baked potatoes ever! This colorful salad bowl came together in little to no time , thanks to my always present precooked black beans . Black beans are probably one of my favorite. You can tell from the many bean recipes that I absolutely love beans. My ultimate, guilt free source of protein in various forms. From bean burgers, to stews, soups, salads and much more.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/IMG_3480.jpg?resize=1280%2C1920&ssl=1]
When in doubt and hunting for a quick meal, my precooked beans always come to the rescue. Today was one of those days. These days I'm all about quick meals, flavor packed with no fuss. My little girl is down for her afternoon nap, I have a million and one thing to do and I'm starving. what can I whip up for dinner before she's up again? How about a hearty black bean salad bowl with garlic thyme roasted potatoes.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/Snapseed-5.jpg?resize=1192%2C1192&ssl=1]
These potatoes! Oh my world are they delicious! They almost didn't make it to the salad because I kept telling myself "just one more". I can't wait to make more ! These are totally replacing my fries during burger nights. Cutting them thin and baking at high heat gives that extra crunch with each bite. Imagine that with some ketchup, ranch or your favorite aioli recipe. Oh so good I tell ya. These were however mixed in with the beans, giving this salad some extra body .
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/IMG_3476.jpg?resize=1280%2C1595&ssl=1]
The incredible flavors and colors of this dish speaks for itself. It's not only hearty and healthy but also super affordable to make. With under $10 you can feed at least a family of four. Protein packed with just what the body needs. I hope you entertain the idea of making a batch for your family or during your next gathering. You'll definitely get your guests asking for the recipe.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/IMG_3472.jpg?resize=1280%2C1280&ssl=1]
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/10/IMG_3471.jpg?resize=1252%2C1118&ssl=1]
SPICY BLACK BEAN SALAD BOWL
Black beans cooked with fresh spices / peppers and garlic thyme roasted potatoes.
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 30 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 3 Cups cooked black beans
- 2 Cups Red bell pepper diced
- 1 Cup Onions chopped
- 1/4 Cup Chopped scallions
- 1/2 Cup Chopped celery
- 2 Tbsp minced garlic
- 1 Tbsp Minced ginger
- Salt to taste
- 1 Small scotch bonnet or harbanero (Deseeded and minced (wear gloves))
Roasted potatoes
- 1 Tbsp olive oil
- 3 Cloves of garlic Minced
- 1 Tsp black pepper
- 1 Tsp Kosher salt
- 2 Sprigs Of fresh thyme
Instructions
Potatoes
1. Wash, peel and roughly chop potatoes. Transfer into a bowl, mix well with all potato ingredients and let sit for 10 minutes.
2. Preheat oven to 450. Spread potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for about 20-25 minutes or until potatoes are tender and golden brown. Flip once.
Black bean salad
1. Heat oil in a medium to large skillet. Add onions and sautée for 3-5 minutes until they just start to brown.
2. Add chopped red pepper, celery, a pinch of salt. Cover and cook for another 5 minutes. Then add black beans, and all remaining ingredients. Stir well, cover and cook until vegetables are tender. ( about 5 minutes) season to taste
3. Serve with roasted potatoes on the side or combine with roasted potatoes in a bowl.
Notes
Like I mentioned before, you should definitely wear gloves when mincing the scotch bonnet pepper. You can also combine all ( onions, garlic, ginger, celery ) and pulse with a food processor. This is probably a better method if you haven't worked with scotch bonnet before. An even easier alternative is to add red pepper flakes. Another type of beans that works for this recipe is garbanzo beans. You can replace the Idaho potatoes with sweet potatoes , plantains, cassava (yucca)

Text:
Spicy Caribbean Chickpea Curry with rice
Rainy , cloudy and cold days call for a soup and sandwich of some sort. Nothing should however stop you from trying this spicy Caribbean chickpea curry year round.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/Spicy-Caribbean-Chickpea-Curry.jpg?resize=1280%2C1280&ssl=1]
Since my little girl Baylee was born I realize dinners and lunches are routinely ready in as little as 30 minutes most days. Who would've thought a 13 pound mass would cause dinner to be prepared, consumed and dishes put away (well....sometimes) in an hour? These days I'm amazed at the things I could whip up when I have a small window of time to work with; like this simple Chickpea curry.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/Spicy-Caribbean-Chickpea-Curry-with-rice.jpg?resize=1205%2C1205&ssl=1]
Usually I take an Indian or Kenyan direction with my chickpeas, with the use of garam masala and pilau masala. This time around I wanted a little Caribbean feel. Warm , hearty and spicy; because there is no other way to go. Sweet yellow curry, hot Jamaican style curry, Allspice, Spanish paprika and more cooked with a fresh herb blend of scallions, garlic , ginger, scotch bonnet pepper all marry to create a flavor profile that will take your palate on a satisfying culinary journey. And did I mention it was ready in about 30 minutes? Used some canned garbanzo beans ( chickpeas) but you are welcome to soak dehydrated beans overnight for this recipe. It will probably take a little longer for the beans to cook but I'm sure its worth the wait. We enjoyed it with some basmati rice . My husband , my recipe critique gave me a 4.5/5 star and when I asked why not 5, he said brown rice would've made it better. My excuse? Which is a very VALID one is that I was too hungry to wait for that brown rice to cook. And who doesn't love basmati rice? It's one of my favorite.
If you're like me (well...not necessarily a parent), and have at least 30 minutes to spare for a heart home cooked meal, try this Chickpea curry. You'll be in and out of the kitchen in no time and very satisfied with your meal.This can also be enjoyed with some naan, injera, cornbread or as is.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/07/Caribbean-Chickpea-Curry.jpg?resize=970%2C970&ssl=1]
SPICY CHICKPEA CURRY WITH RICE
Prep Time: 10 minutes mins, Cook Time: 30 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 2 14 oz Can Garbanzo beans
- 1 1/2 Tbsp Hot Jamaican style curry
- 1/2 Tbsp Sweet yellow curry
- 1 Cup packed Chopped Kale
- 1 Large roma tomato
- 1 Small Scotch bonnet pepper
- 1 Small Scallion
- 1 Small onion ((1/2 diced, 1/2 to. Blended))
- 3 Cloves garlic
- 1/2 Inch cube ginger
- 1 tsp Allspice
- 1 tsp spanish paprika
- 1-2 Cups water
- 1 Tbsp Olive oil or vegetable oil
Instructions
1. Heat oil in a medium skillet and saute onions for about 2 -3 minutes. Add in curry powder and cook for another 2 minutes or so
2. Blend roma tomatoes , scallion, scotch bonnet, ginger , garlic and onions with 1/4 cup of water. Add into skillet and let simmer for about 5 minutes
3. Wash and peel skin off garbanzo beans. Add into skillet with an additional cup and a half of water. Add in Spanish paprika and Allspice. Season with salt, cover and let simmer for 15 minutes.
4. Add in chopped kale. cover and cook for another 5 minutes. Adjust seasoning if necessary
5. Serve with rice ( injera, naan or cornbread)

Text:
Spicy Chickpea Curry with Kale and potatoes
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Spicy-Chickpea-curry-with-potatoes.jpg?resize=1280%2C1280&ssl=1]
Who's down to try this spicy chickpea curry for lunch or dinner? Loaded with some potatoes, kale and spice to booth. There is something very fulfilling about a meal you can whip up in 30 minutes and get the family happily fed in little to no time. Nutritious, delicious and probably the best leftovers for your next day soup and sandwich brunch. You see the yogurt swirl on top? Yea, It was that or hyperventilate throughout dinner because I was a little too heavy handed on the dried ghost pepper.
Our friends down in Omaha have a nice little garden and I was elated when they sent me this little jar of ground dehydrated ghost pepper. Lets just say the jar also came with warnings!!! Caution! This will burn your tongue off. It does have a sweet aroma and you definitely won't need much at all to spice up a pot of soup. To put things into perspective, they are about 10 times hotter than habaneros. Got it? Okay, so feel free to use some chili flakes to spice up your soup because apparently I wasn't thinking straight when I decided to use as much as I did with this recipe.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Chickpea-curry.jpg?resize=1280%2C1280&ssl=1]
Adding Kale and other leafy greens to soups does not only make for a more colorful plate but another way to incorporate greens in my meals. Fell free to toss in a handful of kale during the last few minutes of any soup you're making. It might seem like an after thought but trust me ( maybe?) when I say it adds to the flavor, texture and of course nutritional content.
[image: https://i0.wp.com/afrovitalityeats.com/wp-content/uploads/2017/05/Spicy-Chickpea-Curry.jpg?resize=1776%2C1184&ssl=1]
Can it get anymore wholesome?
Oh yes! Those Idaho potatoes are not for hash browns only. Cut them up and throw them in.
This soup was definitely the way to go when I wanted a quick lunch and I hope it is for you too.
SPICY CHICKPEA CURRY
Prep Time: 5 minutes mins, Cook Time: 30 minutes mins
Ingredients
- 2 cups cooked chickpeas
- 1 cup Idaho Potatoes (peeled and diced)
- 1/2 cup Onions (coarsley chopped)
- 1 Tbsp pilau masala
- 2 Tbsp curry powder
- 1/2 Tbsp corriander
- 1 tsp tumeric root powder
- 6 cloves
- 1 14oz can diced fire roasted tomatoes
- 1 cup packed Chopped Kale
- 2-3 cups water
- 3 Tbsp olive oil
- salt & pepper to taste
Instructions
1. Heat oil in large skillet and saute onions for 2 - 3 minutes. Add in all dried spices and cook for about 2 more minutes until you start to smell the goodness.
2. Add in tomatoes, stir and cook for 4-5 minutes. Then add in diced potatoes, a cup of water and continue to cook until potatoes are almost tender.
3. Add in chickpeas, chopped kale, remaining water , cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until potatoes are soft.
4. Season to taste with salt and serve.
